loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma M. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 2 children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005 and business stability allows him to increase the loan sum. Juma M. is engaged in business of selling men's and children’s wear. He is experienced in business for 10 years. Despite the fact that Mr.M. is an invalid (he has not a right arm), he works intensively to ensure his children a happy and reliable future. He dreams to give his children a good education and profession. Mr. M. requests a loan of US$725 to widen his existing inventory with new imported clothes. This would allow him to increase the family income and to ensure his children a good and happy future.

loans.use: To widen inventory

loans.name: Thi Binh

texts.vi:
Ms Bình is 36 years old, she has a son who's attending school. Everyday she buys fruits and resells at her small stand. She has a lot of customers despite the fact that it's just a small stand. Ms Bình has not borrowed money from a fund before but when she learned about BinhMinh (SEDA), she applied right away. She hopes to obtain a loan so she would be able to expand her fruit stand, offering more varieties.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bình, 36 tuổi có 1 con trai đang đi học phổ thông. Hàng ngày, chi nhập hoa quả về bán tại cửa hàng nhỏ của mình. Cửa hàng tuy nhỏ nhưng khá đông khách. Chị chưa tham gia vay vốn ở đâu nhưng khi biết đến chương trình tài chính vi mô Binhminh chị đã đăng ký vay ngay. Chị hy vọng sẽ được vay với khoản lớn hơn sau này để chị mua thêm hoa quả về bán và hỗ trợ cho công việc kinh doanh của mình.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits for sale

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda M. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 6 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 and is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Mrs. M. is engaged in the business of selling childrens wear and toys. She has a wide-side assortment of clothes and toys. She is very polite and has permanent clients who want to buy only from her. She is very experienced in the business. She wants to widen her existing inventory with new imported models. Now Mrs. M. requests a loan of US$1025 for business development. She wants to widen the business to increase the family income so that her children can get a good education.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Mrs. Huy S., aged 26, is employed at a garment factory, making on average $3 each day. Her husband is a broker purchasing and selling fruit, making around $4 each day. They have one child who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase more fruit to expand the inventory of their family's fruit stand. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy a motor-bike to transport the fruit to a market.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to expand their fruit stand.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. Phun S., aged 37, works selling garlic at the market, earning around $16 per day in revenue. Her husband is a construction foreman, making about $12 per day. They have three children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase more garlic from the grower in greater quantity, and therefore save money through a bulk purchase discount. She plans to use the leftover of the money to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more garlic from the grower to sell.

loans.name: Gaurbek

texts.en: Gaurbek N. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 3 children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005 and business stability allows him to increase the loan sum. Mr.N. is engaged in business of the menswear selling. He has a wide-side assortment that allows him to work with people of different income levels. He dreams to have a roomy home where his family could live happily. Mr. Nazatov requests a loan of US$600 to make a good roof for his home.

loans.use: To make a good roof for his home

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang S., aged 47, works growing and selling vegetables in the market, earning around $2 each day. Husband is employed at a private company, making around $4 per day. They have four children, two of whom are married and two of whom are students. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motor-bike for her son-in-law to operate a motor-taxi business. This will increase the income of the entire family, raising their standard of living and allowing her to better finance her other children’s education. Her son is pictured on the motor-bike they would like to purchase with the Kiva loan.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his business

loans.name: Gulmakhmad

texts.en: Gulmakhmad M. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 4 children. He is a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Mr. M. is in the business of vegetable selling (onion, potato, carrot and etc). He has a direct supplier, which allows her to sell rice at a price that is lower than the bazaar price. He is very polite which is why he has permanent clients who want to buy only his good. Gulmakhmad M. is very experienced in the business. Now Mr. M. requests a loan of US$600 for business development and expanding his inventory.

loans.use: For business development and expanding his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is sixty eight years old man. He had married two wives but the first one died. In his first family, he had ten children but five of them passed on and now only five are live. On the other hand, he has seven children from his second family.
To sustain his big family, Nathan operates a shop at Adanya area in Angurai division of Teso District. This shop is estimated to be worth KES 10,000/=; he basically foods and small stuffs such as salt, sugar, flour and many more.
 To supliment his income, Nathan is a small scale farmer where he plants corn and beans. When harvested, he usually disposes them to pay his children school fees and the remaining kept as food security.
With successful completion of the first loan, Nathan wishes to get another loan so as to harness bigger sales and profit in this December festive season.

loans.use: Increase on his stock.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang T., aged 41, is a garment worker in Phnom Penh and earns about $2 per day.  She also works with her husband on their farm, collectively earning $1 per day by selling crops.  They have five children, four of which are full-time students.  She would like to request a loan of $800 to purchase pigs to raise and resell at the market in six months for a profit.  They plan to use the increased income to help fund their children’s education and increase their family’s savings.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and resell at market.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 40-year-old entrepreneur. She lives with her husband and six of his children in Kisumu, Kenya. Carolyne runs a handicraft business with her husband that they initiated in 1990. The business is situated along a busy road often used by tourists. She uses locally available papyrus reeds that are found along the lake to make baskets, traditional seatts (selling prices ranges between US $55.55 to US $ 285.70) , caps and brooms used by the locals.

Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loan funds; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock of items for sale and build a successful income-generating activity. Carolyne is proud of her accomplishments and now requires US $ 1000 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Lim C. H., age 39, earns about $1.60 a day as a secondary school.  Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and earns about $2.50 each day in revenue.  They have four children in school and one child working in a garment factory.  She would like to request a loan for $600 to purchase peanut seeds, rice seeds, and fertilizer to grow crops on her piece of land to sell at market.  By purchasing the seeds in large amounts, she hopes to take advantage of bulk discounts and increase profitability.  They plan to use the supplemental income to expand their farm and help fund their children’s education. Her husband is pictured outside their home as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase peanut seeds, rice seeds, and fertilizer to grow crops on her piece of land to sell at market.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mr. Sor L. S., 29, is married with one little child and lives with his wife and his mother Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support his household, he and his wife work on their piece of farmland growing rice crops, earning collectively around $3.5/day. Mr. Sor L. S. would like to generate another source of his family’s income by working as a motor-taxi driver while he is free from his farm. He is confident that this new business will enable him to raise his household’s revenue. (His wife is pictured because Mr. Sor L. S. was unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to run a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Davron

texts.en: Davron K. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 4 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Mr. K. is in the business of livestock, milk-sour products sales. He works intensively. He dreams of buying a wide and roomy home so his family could live happily . Now he requests a loan of US$600 to buy a home.

loans.use: to buy a home

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mrs. Khat S., aged 25, sells fresh water and soft drinks at a stand and earns about $2.50 a day.  Her husband earns $2.50 a day as a taxi-conductor.  The couple has three young children.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase motorbike for her to start a taxi business.  They plan to save the additional income generated from the business to help fund their children’s education when they start school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a motor-taxi business.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Khat Samoeun and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is a very vivacious, outgoing person. She took me all over town visiting the other clients. When it came to visiting Frisita Nakieya we had to get on a boda boda (motorbike) to reach Frisita’s still. (That’s right; still, as in moonshine.) So, Carol gets us a boda boda driver and tells me to hop on. Then she tells me to squeeze up tight to the driver - real tight. And with one more big push she climbs on behind me, riding side saddle! Between the driver and Carol, I was as happy and as bubbly as a slice of hot cheese in a grilled cheese sandwich. We went for 45 minutes on a dirt trail through the hills with views of Lake Victoria that brought tears to your eyes. Man, this is what traveling is all about! But this is a story of Carol and her business.

Carol owns a hair salon called Mama Emannuel’s Beauty Salon. As I indicated before, she is a classy, well-dressed lady with a heck of a spirit. She has been operating her salon for 8 years and for the past 10 years has been bringing her upbeat attitude to her lending group. At 32 years old, she is married with 5 children. Her dreams are to educate her children so that they can go to the university and to enlarge her business. For now, she plans to use her loan to buy more braids, weaves, shampoos and chemicals for her business. She brings a joy to the people around her.

loans.use: Carol plans to use her loan to buy more braids, weaves, shampoos and chemicals for her hair salon.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary O. is a 27-year-old married mother of 2 children. She has spent two years learning the art of dressmaking/embroidery and has offered her tailoring services within her community in Kisumu, Kenya since 2002.  She specializes in making women’s dresses, men’s shirts and also embroidery.  Despite the stiff competition in her area, Rosemary has always been able to attract old and new customers.  She constantly updates her materials to keep up with the current fashions, offers a wide selection of patterns and maintains a good stock to meet her customers’ demands.  Her hard work, years of experience and well-established client base ensure that her business will continue to succeed.  She plans to use three quarters of her next loan of US $ 800 to buy new patterns and materials, and save the remaining amount into her  account to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: Buy stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Frisita

texts.en:
And then there’s Frisita. I don’t know what it is about these remote villages, but they sure do have their share of characters! As I mentioned in another story, Kiyinde is a very remote fishing village on the shores of Lake Victoria. Frisita insisted that I see her business, though it was a 45 minute boda boda ride into the dense tropical forest on a rutted dirt trail. (Read Carol Nakintu's story for more detail). Having come from the wine country of Northern California, I know the smell of fermenting alcohol, and I could smell Frisita’s business at least a quarter mile away. We got off the boda boda and walked through a large thicket of sugar cane. Right in the middle was what you see in the picture. When in operation, a cow is attached to the log and sugar cane is pressed through the press in the middle squeezing the juices into a bucket in the middle. The raw sugar and juice is then placed in 50 gallon drums to start fermenting. There were five 50 gal. drums full to the brim all bubbling from the fermentation. After fermentation, the liquid is taken to a 50 gal. drum that is laying sideways over a smoldering fire next to a cool stream that was just below. In the stream is a another 50 gal. drum that is kept cool by the stream. A hose connects the two drums. The heated fermented liquid releases the alcohol up the hose and then drips into the cooled drum in the stream and viola! Moonshine!

Now you may wonder why you might want to invest in moonshine. But I’m here to tell you that even if you think this is not the best cause going, you can at least brag to your friends that you’re a moonshiner! And for me, this is a story I will be telling for a long time! The world needs more Frisita’s!! In a more serious manner, her business in Uganda is considered legitimate. She will sell her products in town and also to the island villages.

loans.use: Frisita plans to use her loan for the costs of transporting her spirits to retail stores.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has a retail shop in Kiyinde. I’ve got to tell you, I think the women of Kiyinde are the main act. The men go fishing and the women run the joint while the men are out in their boats. But a few guys hold down the fort during the day. John is one of those guys. For the past nine years, John has been operating a retail store where he sells bread, maize flour, beans, sugar, popcorn, salt, cassava and other basic essentials.

John is married with 10 children and he takes care of 7 orphans. Actually, I have found that in the more remote villages there is a definite increase in the number of children in the families. When I came into Kiyinde on a one hour boda boda, motorbike, on a rutted dirt road, I was immediately taken by the number of children in town.

John has a very pleasant personality and his store serves a vital need in a village as remote as Kiyinde.

loans.use: John plans to use his loan to stock his store with bags of flour, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Sepi

texts.en:
Sepi is a widow, 36 years old, with 10 children. In addition, she cares for 2 orphans. If you have read some of my other stories about the people in the village of Kiyinde, you know I can’t stop talking about all the babies. Within the last three stories I have a baby head count of 30 babies amongst 3 families. What’s going on in Kiyinde? I do have a theory. These remote villages are very family oriented. The joy of children is quite evident. There is not a lot to do and the men are out fishing all day. What I notice are the women all look after each other in a special way. Caring for babies unites them. Since there are few or no jobs, women have plenty of time to visit as they watch after each others' babies. The land is fertile so food is plentiful and easy to grow, so you do not have to worry about getting food, and the lake provides ample fish.

Sepi has a small retail store in Kiyinde. She sells cooking oil, sugar, maize flour, bread, beans and cosmetics. She will use her loan to buy supplies for her store. She dreams of buying a plot of land to build a house and hopes to educate her children so they can go to the university.

loans.use: Sepi plans to use her loan to buy more dry staples in bulk.

loans.name: Swabra

texts.en:
Swabra has a wholesale beverage depot. Most villages have one distributor. The distributor has a contract with the bottler, who delivers to them in cases of 24 bottles to a case. Usually the distributor will receive about 200 cases at a time. They will store the cases in the depot and then deliver to the retail shops as needed. This is a very good business as you have a solid contract with the bottler and there is little or no competition.

Swabra has had her wholesale business for 5 years. Kiyinde is a fishing village on the shores of Lake Victoria, the source of the Nile. Her business extends to the surrounding islands, where she delivers soft drinks, wine, beer and spirits. Her business is doing quite well for being in a small village. With her loan, she will pay for more deliveries of beverages. She would like one day to buy a small plot of land, and build a house. She also hopes to see her children receive a good education and go to the university.

loans.use: Swabra plans to use her loan to purchase more beverages for her wholesale business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
So, how do you like your meat? On the hoof, or a table sized slab? Any way you like it, Hamida and her husband aim to please. Hamida is a mother of 12. (As I told you in another story, there were a lot of babies in Kiyinde.)

At any rate, I talked to him about the butcher business, which they have been in for 10 years. He told me that every week he goes to market to pick 3 cows and one goat for slaughter. He has to travel 200 miles to the north where the Ankole cattle are raised. These are the cattle with tremendous horns curving upwards three to four feet high above their heads. He goes with 5 other butchers from his region and they load up a truck with about 20 cattle.

At time of slaughter, they must sell all the meat within 2 days because there is no refrigeration. They can expect to get about 100 kg of meat on the bone from each cow. With their loan, Hamida and her husband plan to put the money back into their business. They are very friendly and I thoroughly enjoyed visiting with them.

loans.use: Hamida and her husband  will use their loan to buy more cows for their butcher business.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en: Abdukodir O. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 4 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 but already is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  He is in the business of food selling. He has a wide-side assortment of goods and permanent clients who buy milk-sour products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products and etc. He now wants to widen his existing inventory and requests a loan of US$1200 for business development.

loans.use: for business development.

loans.name: Mirzoolim

texts.en: Mirzoolim N. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 4 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he has been a good client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is in business of livestock-raising and selling.  He would like to purchase a pedigree bull, to increase his livestock further. Also, he plans to produce  pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream and curd and supply it to bazaars.  He works intensively to widen the existing business to increase his family's well-being. Now he requests a loan of US $525 to support the existing business and to implement new opportunities.

loans.use: To support the existing business and develop new opportunities

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano N. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 2 children. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006 and is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is the teacher by profession but for the last years has been in the business of selling womenswear. She is ready to work intensively to ensure the happy future to her children. Stable business and income has helped her pay back previous loans and feel comfortable asking for a new one.  Now she requests a loan of US$725 for business development by buying more inventory.

loans.use: For womenswear business development

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma O. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 2 children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006 and is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mr. O. sells vegetables (onion, potato, carrot and etc). He has a straight supplier that allows him to sell the rice by a price that is lower than the bazaar price. He is very polite which is why he has permanent clients who want to buy from him. Mr.O. is very experienced in the business. He requests a loan of US$725 to develop the onion selling business.

loans.use: to develop the onion selling business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old, married with 7 children, and she cares for 5 orphans. She both farms and sells second hand clothes. Most people in rural areas farm a small plot of land next to their home, just enough for their family. They are sustenance farmers. Since there are no jobs, unless you start up your own business, sustenance farming is a necessity. The land in Kiyinde is quite fertile, so there is no problem with supplying your family with the basic staple foods, add a few chickens and some fish from Lake Victoria and life is pretty good. The developed world has a view of poverty in the developing world that is largely skewed by marketing.

Mary supplies the family with some income by also selling second hand clothing. She will travel several hours to Kampala and buy a bale of clothes for a set amount. A bale can contain several hundred items of used clothing. She will separate the items and set up a stand in her village to resell them for a small profit. With her loan she will pay her children’s school fees and continue buying bales for resale.

loans.use: Mary plans to use her loan to continue buying more bales of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Masitula

texts.en: Masitula is 30 years old, married with 2 of her own children and she cares for 4 orphans. She is in the poultry business and has 350 chickens. Her chickens are layers, so she gets a little less than one egg per day per chicken. She will sell them wholesale in trays of 36 eggs to a tray and each tray will be sold for about 3,000 schillings or about $1.75US per tray. Therefore, if you do the math, she will get about 9 trays per day x $1.75 per tray and you see she will gross about $15.00US per day. Out of that she will have to take into account the cost of the chickens, the feed, etc. But this is a very good business if you have enough room for a lot of chickens, and on a small plot of land 350 chickens are a lot of chickens. You also have to construct a well ventilated room with a roof for the chickens. But in a country where the average annual income is about $1,085.US, this can be a good business. With her loan, Masitula will buy more chicken feed for her chickens.

loans.use: Masitula plans to use her loan to buy chicken feed for her layers.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a butcher who is married with 6 children and one dependent. For the past five years, he has traveled two hundred miles once per week to buy two cows for slaughter. Since there is no refrigeration, the meat must be sold within 2 days. He will pay about 500,000 schillings for the animal on the hoof or about $300.00US. Once back in Kiyinde, he will slaughter the animal and be able to market about 100kgs of beef on the bone. His gross profit will be about $25.00US per cow; out of that he will have to take the cost of hired help, rent, and transportation.

But a butcher is a skilled trade and always in demand, so this is a business which can be passed on to family members. With his loan, Christopher will use the money to pay for transportation costs and rent.

loans.use: Christopher will use his loan to pay for transporting his purchased cows.

loans.name: Hasifer

texts.en: Hasifer is a 41 year old widow with 7 children, and she cares for 3 orphans. For the past 18 years she has run a retail shop where she sells basic essentials to the villagers. Her shop is like so many others of its kind selling maize flour, soap, bread, sugar, sodas, beer, etc. In the villages, it is quite common to see businesses that look exactly the same. In poor areas, you can not afford “luxury” items so everyone sells the basic essentials. It should be noted that few people lack for the basics and their needs are not forever growing like in the developed world. So far, they have not been marketed to the point that they begin to believe they are lacking in something. For the most part, the villages are quite pleasant, safe, with a strong sense of community. People have time to visit and look after their children. Time passes much more slowly, and I find it a great respite from the developed world. With her loan Hasifer will continue to stock her small store with items for her village. One of her dreams to buy a matatoo which she would operate to and from her village.

loans.use: Hasifer plans to use her loan to stock her small store with items for her village.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en: Sima is a very energetic 23 year old, married with one child. She operates both a retail shop and a hair salon in Kiyinde. I know I have talked about Kiyinde before in other stories, but I want to emphasize the quality of life that exists in some of these villages. Although quite economically poor, the people are not suffering from poverty. In fact, their lives in many respects are much richer than many lives in the developed world. They share a strong sense of community. There is little crime and plenty of food from small plots that each person cultivates next to their homes. There is little or no paid work, so people like Sima open small businesses. There is very little diversity in the businesses as no one can afford “luxury” items. But on the other hand there is very little want. Simi would like to be able to buy a small plot of land and build her own home, but she loves her village and has no desire to leave in search for something more. With her loan she will buy more bulk bags of sugar, flour, and rice for her retail store.

loans.use: With her loan, Simi plans to buy more bulk bags of sugar, flour, rice for her retail store.

loans.name: Bacharou

texts.fr:
Mr. Bacharou O. has been a livestock trader for the last 10 years. He is 42 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He buys livestock (poultry, goats, sheep etc…) in the surrounding villages and sells them to the butchers in his town. This business brings in a substantial income allowing him to provide for the needs of his family. This loan will allow him to increase his year end stock in order to cope with the needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mr Bacharou O. est commerçant de bétail depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est agé de 42 ans , marié et père de 2 enfants. Il achète les bêtes (volailles, chèvres , moutons etc..) dans les villages environnants et les revends au x bouchers de la localité . Cette activité lui procure un revenu substantiel qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de la famiille. Le présent emprunt lui permet d'augmenter son stock de fin d'année afin de faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 additional animals for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Sani

texts.fr:
35 year old Mr. Sani A. M. is married and the father of 2 children. For the last 6 years, he has been the owner of a shoe shop at the market of Adéta. He buys shoes in bulk in Lomé and sales them retail at the local market. His business is very well managed and provides him with an income to finance the household expenses and the school fees for his children. Currently, his customer base is expanding which explains this loan to increase the variety of shoes.

Agé de 35 ans Mr Sani A. M. est marié et père de 2 enfants.Il est propriétaire d'une boutique de vente de chaussures au marché d'Adéta depuis plus de 6 ans. Il achète les chaussures en gros à Lomé et les revend en détail sur le marché local. Son activité est très bien gérée et lui procure un revenu qui finance les charges de foyer et les charges scolaires de ses enfants. Actuellement il a une clientèle en pleine croissance ce qui explique cet emprunt pour augmenter la variété des chaussures.

loans.use: Mr. Ali wants to use his loan to increase the working capital of his shoe selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret O. is a 49-year-old entrepreneur and mother of six school-aged children.  
She lives with her husband in Kisumu, Kenya.  She began her current business of selling second-hand clothes in the year 2000.  She specializes in selling women's dresses, mosquito nets, towels, men’s shirts, casual wear and bed sheets.  She periodically travels to Nairobi, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices.  The prime location of her business on a busy street, her many years in business and her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good client base.  Margaret plans to expand her business with her next loan of US $800.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mensah

texts.fr:
Mr. Amessé Mensah is 38 years old, married and the father of 3 children all in school. Mr. Mensah buys fish in refrigeration in Kpalimé, smokes them and then resales them at the local market for consumption. He has been practicing this activity for over 10 years and it is his only income to provide for the household. With the holidays approaching the demand is increasing and to cope with this demand this loan will be useful to Mr. Kpalimé.

Mensah Amessé est agé de 38 ans , marié et père de 3 enfants scolarisés.Monsieur Mensah achete les poissons dans les frigos à Kpalimé, les fume et les revend sur le marché local pour la consommation. Il exercice cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et est la seule source de revenu pour le financement des charges familiales. A l'approche des fêtes la demande augmente et c'est pour faire face à cette demande que le présent emprunt est utile à Monsieur Mensah.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 boxes of fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es:
Vladimir works as a security guard in a privately owned company. His salary is the only means of income that he can rely on to sustain his family. His wife take cares of all the housework and their two children, who are at school. They live in the district of Tunari in the town of Rió Sec, which is part of the city of El Alto.

Vladimir obtained his first loan through Kiva and it was paid back in total. He wishes to borrow a new loan in the same manner. The previous loan was used to finish some construction in his home. It was missing a patio and some walls. With the new loan, he wishes to buy construction materials (cement and bricks) to build walls for his family's security and protection. This is the fourth loan with IMPRO and the second with Kiva. The previous loans enable him to receive another credit loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. Vladimir trabaja como empleado de seguridad de un empresa privada; el sueldo que percibe es su único ingreso con el que cuenta para mantener a su familia; la esposa realiza trabajos de labores de casa y cuida a sus dos hijos que están en el colegio; vive en la Zona Villa Tunari de la ciudad de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

Vladimir ya obtuvo un primer crédito a través de Kiva, el cual está pagado en su totalidad; de esta manera él desea solicitar un nuevo crédito. El crédito anterior lo utilizo en la culminación de sus habitaciones, lo que le falta es el patio y la muralla. Con el nuevo préstamo que desea obtener Vladimir desea comprar material de construcción (cemento y ladrillo) para poder construir la muralla que necesita para mayor protección a su familia. Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo con KIVA, los antecedentes anteriores le facultan para aprobar la solicitud de crédito presentada.

loans.use: To build a protective wall around his house

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela is a producer of cow's milk and is also a small potato and chuño farmer, products which she markets in the city of La Paz. Her husband is a builder and the main family income comes from both activities, which help to care for Marcela's two sons and mother. She lives in the Ninachiri-Laja community, an hour and a half outside the city of La Paz. The loan which she is requesting will be used to buy an average breed cow in order to increase milk production, and therefore improving the family income.

It is her first loan with Impro; the evaluation which has been carried has proven that her request for a loan is viable.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer.

Marcela es productora de leche de vaca y pequeña agricultora de papa y chuño, los mismos que comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo es albañil y los ingresos principales de la familia se derivan de ambas actividades; con los que mantiene a sus dos hijos y madre. Vive en la Comunidad de Ninachiri - Laja (A una hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Muhoroni Blue Star Group

texts.en:
Henry has been in the tailoring business for over 5 years. He started with a borrowed sewing machine, which he used for two years before buying his own machine. During this period, he had to pay back part of his profit sto the owner of the machine while he saved money to buy his own. Due to hard work, he expanded his business until now he has 3 sewing machines.

He is 40 years old and married with 8 children. He has 3 orphans, his late brother's children, that he also takes care of. He uses profits from this business to take care of his family. Two of his children are in secondary school and their school fees have been paid with this money. He intends to use this money to increase the clothing stock for his business.

Henry believes that the determination that has enabled him to grow his business and enabled him to expand from renting a sewing machine to owning 3 of his own, will enable him to expand his business to a large size with more sewing machines. He also believes that he has carved his own niche due to his good and stylish finishings.

Henry is the Chairman of his group and he believes he will use his strong leadership skills to ensure the group pays on time and gets subsequent loans so that he can benefit from more loans to further increase his business size and hence profits. The group has maintained a good attendance rate, coming to meetings on time during training, and are quite cohesive.

loans.use: To increase business stock

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is a retailer and owns the Bazar bookstore on Buenos Aires Avenue in the city of La Paz. She has a daughter who is studying at the state university and also helps Esperanza at the bookstore. This activity is Esperanza´s main source of income with which she supports herself and her daughter. They live in the Villa Nueva Potosí area of La Paz.

The credit she requests through Kiva will be used to buy merchandise (toys) for the year-end holidays, and in this way she´ll be able to continue with the store sales (Bazar bookstore).

This is her fourth credit with IMPRO; an evaluation was done to qualify her for the loan. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2003 and is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza es comerciante y tiene una Librería Bazar en la Av. Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene una hija que esta postulando a la Universidad estatal y al mismo tiempo ayuda a Esperanza en la librería. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con que Esperanza y su hija se mantienen; vive en la Zona de Villa Nueva Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito que solicita a través de Kiva lo destinara para la compra de mercadería (juguetes) por las fiestas de fin de año, de esa forma podrá continuar con las ventas de tienda (librería-Bazar).

Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2003 y es considerada un excelente cliente.

loans.use: Purchase toys to sell during year-end holidays.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo is an artisan in embroidery. He makes costumes for traditional dance in Bolivia. His wife is a retailer who sells meat, and both activities are their main source of revenue with which they maintain their two small school-age children. They live in the Villa de Dolores area of the city of La Paz.

A loan is needed to make the CHUTA costumes for Carnaval (Mardi-Gras) celebrations, so that he can increase the amount he makes, which is his capital investment. The CHUTA is one of the typical personalities of Carnaval in La Paz. Their outfit or disguise is very beautiful and highly sought-after by persons who participate in the parade that marks the beginning of Carnaval.

This is Pablo´s fourth credit with IMPRO. His prior record qualifies him to be approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Pablo es artesano en bordados, confecciona disfraces de danzas tradicionales de Bolivia, la esposa es comerciante de carne y ambas actividades son su principal fuente de ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de dos pequeños hijos que están en edad escolar; vive en la Zona Villa de Dolores Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito es requerido para confeccionar disfraces de CHUTA para las fiestas de carnavales, de esa forma incrementara la cantidad de prendas que es su capital de inversión. El CHUTA es uno de los muchos personajes típicos del Carnaval de la ciudad de La Paz y su vestimenta o disfraz es muy bonito y apetecido por los componentes de las comparsas que desfilan durante la entrada del Carnaval.

Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por el prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make CHUTA costumes.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando is a general mechanic who provides maintenance service for private and public vehicles at his workshop located in the city of El Alto. This activity is the main source of income with which he provides for his two children, who are 2 and 4 years old. His wife takes care of the home; they live in the Villa Tejada Rectangular area of the city of El Alto.

The credit is needed to buy a machine for work (compressor) and materials, so that he can carry out his work more comfortably.

This is his first credit with IMPRO; an evaluation was made to approve Armando for the loan he requests.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Armando es mecánico general y presta servicio de mantenimiento a vehículos particulares y públicos en su taller que está ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad, la esposa realiza labores de casa; vive en la Zona Villa Tejada Rectangular de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para comprar herramienta de trabajo (compresora) y materia prima de esa forma podrá realizar su trabajo con mayor comodidad.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por Armando.

loans.use: Purchase of a compressor for his mechanic workshop.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio has been a public transportation driver for more than 30 years. He drives his taxi in the inter-city area of La Paz to El Alto. This is the primary means to support his daughter, his young granddaughter, and his wife. They live in region of Satélite in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to change the fuel of his taxi from gasoline to natural gas, which will allow him to save 50% on costs, since the natural gas is cheaper than gasoline. This is the first loan with IMPRO, and a credit evaluation approves him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Emilio es transportista de servicio público por más de 30 años. Trabaja con su taxi como Trufi Inter ciudad La Paz – El Alto, siendo su actividad su principal con la que mantiene a su hija y pequeña nieta y esposa. Vive en la zona Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para cambiar combustible a su taxi de gasolina a Gas natural vehicular; dicho cambio le permitirá un ahorro en combustible de 50% pues el costo del gas natural es mucho más barato que el costo de la Gasolina. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To change the fuel in his taxi from gasoline to liquid natural gas

loans.name: Lizeth Mariela

texts.es:
Client's background: Lizeth has a store where she sells toys and children's clothing. She has one son and is separated from her husband. As a result, she is the only one earning money to sustain her family. Her home and store are situated in the region of Alto San Antonio in the city of La Paz. This is the first time that she seeks a loan. The total amount will be used to buy merchandise (toys and children's shirts and pants). Her work approves her for this loan as she possess experience in her business, which provides her the means to cover the costs of the loan and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. Historia del Cliente: Lizeth tiene una tienda donde vende juguetes y ropa de niño. Tiene un hijo y esta separada de su esposo por lo cual es la única que genera ingresos para la sobre vivencia de su familia. Su domicilio y tienda se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (juguetes, poleras y pantalones de niños). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: To buy toys and children's clothing

loans.name: Liz Karoti

texts.es:
Liz belongs to the The Esmeraldas Communal Bank. She lives in the Human settlement 4 Suyos Mz A Lt.. 08, the Callería district, Ucayali department. She is 30 years of age, and is the mother of 2 small children. Her husband works in a loading dock, but the income that he brings in, is not enough to cover the household expenses. So Liz, with the first loan she received from Manuela Fields of S /. 300.00 ($ 100.00) decided to invest in the sale of new and used clothing.

She currently has a small spot located in her home and also travels on the river to offer her products in various remote locations of the city. After doing the housework, she goes out looking for clothes to be used in buying and selling.

Now, with the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos of S /. 1000 ($ 335.00 approx.), which will be paid in 5 months, she plans to supplement her inventory by purchasing 5 dozen blouses, 2 dozen slacks, 10 pairs of shoes, 20 pairs of sandals and accessories for ladies, men and children.

Liz is very happy to have their 2 healthy children, who are her joy, and also to see that her her business thrives. This is a major achievement for her and has improved the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Liz pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano 4 Suyos Mz A Lt. 08, del distrito Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo trabaja como estibador (obrero de carga), pero el ingreso que tienen no les alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Liz, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la venta de ropas de primera y segunda mano. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño puesto ubicado en su casa y también viaja constantemente por el río a ofrecer sus productos en los diversos caseríos (lugares alejados de la ciudad). Después de hacer los quehaceres de la casa se va a buscar la ropa que va a comprar y llevar para vender. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 335.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, incrementará la compra habitual de prendas de vestir, comprará 5 docenas de blusas, 2 docenas de polos y también comprara 10 pares de zapatos, 20 pares sandalias y accesorios de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Liz está muy contenta de tener sanos a sus 02 hijos que son su alegría y su razón de ser, además de ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, gracias a ello ha podido alcanzar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes and accessories for sale in her business. (Compra de prendas de vestir, calzado y accesorios.)

loans.name: Magnolia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magnolia belongs to the Mujeres Virtuosas communal bank, and lives in the district of Callería, department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a salesman, but his income was not enough so Magnolia, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, put up a small store to sell shoes and sandals at the entrance to Market No. 2 in her city.

Currently her business is growing, and now she sells stockings, shoes and sandals. In the mornings she takes care of her housework and after taking care of her children, leaves to go to her business.

With another loan from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 50 pairs of shoes, 10 dozen sandals of all kinds and 10 dozen stockings, since now that the Christmas holidays are coming she has many requests from her customers.

Magnolia is very pleased because her business is going well, and this is an important achievement for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Magnolia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano 11 de Julio 147, del distrito Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no les alcanza, es así que Magnolia, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos decide poner una pequeña tienda de venta de zapatos y sandalias en la puerta del mercado Nº 2 de nuestra ciudad.

En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido, ahora vende medias, zapatos y sandalias. Por las mañanas se dedica a las labores de su casa, después de atender a sus hijos, sale con destino hacia su negocio. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 50 pares de zapatos, 10 docenas de sandalias en todos los modelos y 10 docenas de medias, ya que se acercan las fiestas navideñas y tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes. Magnolia está muy contenta porque le va bien en su negocio, y es un logro muy importante para ella y para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of footwear in bulk.

loans.name: Margarita Micaela

texts.es:
Margarita Micaela, despite her 60 years, works hard to support her family. She has 9 children though only 2 still live with her. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She earns a living making shoes which she sells at various markets in the area.

Margarita is a member of the Mujeres Valerosas ("Courageous Women") community bank from which she received her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100), money that she used to buy rubber soles and shoe patterns. She recently received a loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.500 (about US$167), to be repaid in 4 months, with which she will buy synthetic materials, soles, pigments, leather and patterns because she has orders to fill for end-of-year celebrations.

Margarita is president of a locally-popular canteen called Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn"). Her greatest hope is to have a well-established workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margarita Micaela a pesar de sus 60 años de edad trabaja mucho para mantener a su familia. Tiene 9 hijos pero solo 2 dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a la fabricación artesanal de calzado, el mismo que distribuye en los diferentes mercados del Distrito de La Esperanza. La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas”, en este banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) con los que compró plantas de goma y hormas. Recientemente ha obtenido un crédito de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 (aproximadamente $167) para cancelarlo en 4 meses, con este dinero comprará material sintético, plantas, pegamentos, cuero, hormas porque tiene pedidos que atender de calzado de fiesta para estas fiestas de fin de año. La señora Margarita es presidenta de un comedor popular de su sector llamado “Nuevo Amanecer”. Su mayor sueño es tener una fábrica bien implementada.

loans.use: Buy materials for shoe-making business.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas is 45 years old, married and has three children. He lives in the humble Memorial Sandino district of Managua and works as a taxi driver. He wants to construct a small room for his only daughter so she has her own space and privacy, since all his children currently sleep in the same room.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Leonidas tiene 45 años de edad, es casado, con 3 hijos. Habita en el humilde barrio Memorial Sandino y trabaja como taxista. Necesita construir un pequeño cuarto para dárselo a su única hija mujer para que tenga su espacio y privacidad, ya que todos los hijos duermen en el mismo cuarto.

loans.use: Purchase wood and supplies to build a room for his daughter

loans.name: Angostura 1 Group

texts.es:
Consuelo, together with her husband, fishes for a living. She's 42 years old and has five children. The other members of the group are employed in the same line of work which provides them with the income they need to support their families. Commercial fishing is the predominant activity in this area, near Presa La Angostura, and the principal source of family income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

CONSUELO JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN A LA PESCA, ELLA TIENE 42 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS.LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SE DESEMPEÑAN EN LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD, YA QUE DE ESTA FORMA OBTIENEN INGRESOS PARA EL GASTO FAMILIAR. PORQUE ESTA ACTIVIDAD ES PREDOMINANTE EN LA ZONA QUE VIVEN.YA QUE SE LOCALIZA CERCA DE LA PRESA DE LA ANGOSTURA Y ES LA FUENTE INGRESOS DE LAS FAMILIAS DEL SECTOR.

loans.use: Buy fishing nets and other fishing implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his shop business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
Maria is 41 years old, married and has three school-age children. She sells natural drinks out of her small home. Her husband is a taxi driver, and they both work hard to keep the family moving forward and provide for their children. Maria is requesting the loan to put up bricks in the home and change a door that is in very poor shape.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria con 41 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar. En su Pequeña vivienda ella vende refrescos naturales. Su esposo es taxista ambos han luchado para salir adelante y darle a sus pequeños hijos lo necesario para subsistir, necesita el dinero para ponerle ladrillo al piso y cambiarle a un cuarto la puerta que se encuentra en muy mal estado.

loans.use: Purchase bricks for their home and a new door

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Angostura 2 Group

texts.es:
Consuelo, 48, is married and has two children; her husband is a farm laborer. She earns a living raising pigs which she subsequently sells, live or butchered, to local buyers. Like her, Miriam earns a living raising and selling pigs. The other borrowers engage in various activities: Maria de Lourdes has a business making fishing nets; Marilu has a small store in her house where she sells sweets; Yolanda has a business selling chicken pieces. The group will divide up the loan so that each member will be able to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

CONSUELO TIENE 48 AÑOS, CASADA, DOS HIJOS Y SU ESPOSO SE DESEMPEÑA EN EL CAMPO COMO AGRICULTOR. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS PARA POSTERIORMENTE VENDERLOS VIVOS O TROZADOS ENTRE LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD. AL IGUAL QUE ELLA MIRIAM SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE LOS MISMOS ANIMALES. EL RESTO DE LAS INTEGRANTES TIENE ACTIVIDADES DIVERSAS. EN EL CASO DE MARIA DE LOURDES ELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR MALLAS PESQUERAS, MARILU TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA EN SU CASA DONDE VENDE DULCES PARA SUSTENTAR EL ALIMENTO FAMILIAR, YOLANDA SE DEDICA AL VENTA DE POLLOS TROZADOS. EL GRUPO REPARTIRA EL PRESTAMO PARA CADA CUAL FORTALECER LAS VENTAS DE SU NEGOCIO.

loans.use: Invest in growing their businesses in order to increase their earnings.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 46 years old, married and has three small children. She and her husband have fought to keep the family moving forward. She has worked as a primary education teacher at a public school for 18 years. She wants to put up dividers in the rooms in her home to make it more livable.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa tiene 46 años de edad, casada y con 3 hijos menores de edad, quien junto con el apoyo de su esposo han luchado dignamente para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos. ella se desempeña como profesora de primaria en un colegio público, lleva 18 años transmitiendo sus conocimientos a los niños. Requiere construir las divisiones de cada cuarto para así poder darles una vivienda más digna

loans.use: Purchase dividers for the rooms in her home.

loans.name: Maria Asunción

texts.es:
Maria Asuncion, 49, earns a living making and selling ceviche, soups and lunches on Sundays in a "ramada" (a sheltered space for street vendors) that has been constructed outside of her house in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She has 5 children, 2 of who still live with her.

Maria joined the Bellavista community bank at the invitation of some friends. She received her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) which she used to build the ramada. With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.500 (about US$167), to be repaid in four months, Maria will buy supplies such as rice, pasta, potatoes, onions, etc.

Maria is president of her neighborhood's Mothers Club which provides breakfast for local children and seniors. She dreams of having a restaurant in a better location where she might sell food everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Asunción a sus 49 años se dedica a preparar y vender cebiche, caldos y almuerzos los días domingos en una ramada (espacio para venta ambulante) que ha construido fuera de su casa ubicada en el Sector Los Laureles del Distrito de Florencia de Mora de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Tiene en total 5 hijos, 2 aun dependen de ella.

La señora María se integró al Banco Comunal “Bellavista” por invitación de unas amigas. Obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $ 100) con los que construyó la ramada para la venta de comida. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 (aproximadamente $ 167) para cancelarlos en cuatro meses, comprará insumos para la preparación de alimentos como: arroz, fideos, papa, cebolla, etc.

La señora Maria es presidenta del Club de Madres de su sector el que atiende con desayuno a todos los niños y ancianos. Ella sueña con tener un restaurante mejor ubicado donde pueda vender todos los días.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is a hard-working person, doing everything she can to get ahead and to be able to give her daughter everything she needs. Maria Teresa took a vocational course in sewing and tailoring and she now has a business making sweaters, tableclothes, bedspreads, all kinds of embroidery, and many other products besides. She sells her products in the surrounding area and her neighbors and friends sometimes submit orders. Separately, she has a child-care business. Her neighbors place their highest trust in her: they leave their children in her care while they work. As if that weren't enough, she also makes gelatins, "mazamorra" (a local dessert maD. with corn, fruit, lemon, sugar, etc.) and candy that she sells from her house in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad.

Before receiving her first loan from her community bank, Maria Teresa only knitted sweaters for some friends. Then, with a S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) from the Bellavista community bank, she bought material and started her business. She's saved what she's earned and with a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.500 (about US$167), to be repaid in 4 months, she completed the purchase of a knitting machine that will give her pieces a better finish.

Maria Teresa told us that her hope is to have a well-established workshop for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Teresa es una persona muy trabajadora, hace todo lo que pueD. para salir adelante y para poder darle todo lo que necesita su hija. La señora María Teresa recibió estudios técnicos en confecciones y ahora se dedica a fabricar chompas, tapetes, colchas, alfileteros, todo tipo D. bordados y muchas cosas más, los ofrece por las urbanizaciones, a veces le piden sus vecinos o sus amistades; a parte se dedica al cuidado D. niños y sus vecinos confían mucho en ella, dejan a sus niños en sus manos mientras ellos trabajan; por si fuera poco también prepara gelatina, mazamorra, dulces para venderlos en su domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en la calle Los Ángeles en el distrito D. La Esperanza, Provincia D. Trujillo, Departamento D. La Libertad.

Antes D. recibir su primer préstamo en su Banco Comunal, la señora María Teresa solo tejía chompas para algunas amigas, luego con los S/. 300 (aproximadamente $ 100) que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Bellavista” compró material, con lo inició su negocio D. confección. Fue ahorrando lo que ganaba y con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.500 (aproximadamente $167), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, completó para comprar una máquina remalladora para darle mejor acabado a las prendas que confecciona.

La señora Maria Teresa nos expresa que su mayor dicha seria tener una fábrica D. confecciones bien implementada.

loans.use: Buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Angostura 7 Group

texts.es:
Mercedes is 48 years old, she had eleven children and together with her husband she works fishing. Her group mates Anita and Cecilia work in the same productive activity, with the exception of Maria Silvia who has a general store in her home. In this ways, they obtain the income to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

MERCEDES TIENE 48 AÑOS, TUVO ONCE HIJOS Y JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN A LA PESCA. SUS COMPAÑERAS ANITA Y CECILIA DESEMPEÑAN LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD PRODUCTIVA, A EXCEPCION DE MARIA SILVIA QUE TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. DE ESTA FORMA ELLAS OBTIENE INGRESOS PARA EL SOSTENIENTO FAMILIAR.

loans.use: Investing in buying fishing nets. (INVERTIRAN EN LA COMPRA DE MALLAS PESQUERAS)

loans.name: Caña Castilla 5 Group

texts.es:
Norma works buying live chickens to then sell chicken pieces among the people in her community. She is 24 years old. Orfa works in the same activity. Raxana has a shoe store in her home, and she sells shoes among the people in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

NORMA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA DE POLLOS VIVOS PARA POSTERIORMENTE VENDERLOS TROZADOS ENTRE LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD. ELLA TIENE 24 AÑOS. Y ORFA DESEMPEÑA LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD. RAXANA TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA ZAPATERIA QUE VENDE ENTRE LA GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD.

loans.use: Investing in buying live chickens (INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE POLLOS VIVOS)

loans.name: Olinda Esther

texts.es:
Mrs. Olinda belongs to the communal bank Luchando por Nosotras (fighting for ourselves). She lives in the Pasaje Pomarosa Mz B Lt. 7, in the Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 43 years old and is mother to 3 children whom she adores. Her husband is a technician but his income is not enough, so with the firs loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00), Olinda decided to invest in a small general store.

Currently, Olinda has a well-stocked general store, as well as an Internet and typing business in her own home. Every day she wakes up looking forward to keep working, and the housework is not unattended because she can count on the support of her beloved husband.

With the loan she recently received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 2,000 (US$ 669.00 approx.) which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy 1 printer, 2 reams of paper, 2 sacks of rice, 6 boxes of sodas, and 2 sacks of sugar.

Olinda is very happy for everything she has achieved thanks to the support of her family and the staff of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Olinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotras, vive en el Pasaje Pomarosa Mz. B Lt. 7, del distrito Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años de edad y es madre 3 hijos que son su adoración, su esposo es técnico, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Olinda, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega muy surtida, así mismo tiene su negocio de internet y tipeos en su propia casa, donde todos los días se levanta con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y los quehaceres de la casa no son desatendidos dado que cuenta con el apoyo de su querido esposo.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2.000, (US$ 669.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará de 1 impresora, 1 millar de papel, 2 sacos de arroz, 6 cajas de gaseosa y 2 sacos de azúcar.

Olinda esta muy contenta por todo lo que esta logrando, gracias al apoyo de su familia, y de las promotoras de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Buying assorted products for a general store. (Compra de productos variados (bodega).)

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José is 52 years old and has five children. He runs an open-air business selling home products, and at the same time distributes these products to three other sellers. His children help him with the sales. He's requesting the loan to purchase larger quantities of supplies, since his products are in high demand this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don José Carlos R. tiene 52 años y 5 hijos. Tiene un negocio ambulante de ventas de artículos para el hogar al mismo tiempo que distribuye estos artículos a otros tres vendedores. Sus Hijos le ayudan con el control de las ventas. Solicita el dinero para comprar mayor cantidad de utensilios, ya que en esta época del año se registran mayor número de ventas.

loans.use: Purchase home products

loans.name: Soraida

texts.es:
Mrs. Soraida belongs to the communal bank Luchando por Nosotras (fighting for ourselves). She lives in the Jr. Adolfo Morey 644, in the Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 35 years old and has four children whom she adores and who still depend on her. Her husband is an insurance agent in a commercial store. Thanks to the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 (US$ 100.00) she decided to invest in a small general store.

Currently, she has a well-stocked general store in her own home, in which every day, after taking her children to school, she tends to her business. Her store is busy and frequented by her neighbors because she offers good quality products at good prices.

With the loan recently received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 1,000 (US$ 335.00 approx.), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 1 sack of rice, 1 box of milk, 1 box of oil, 3 boxes of soda, produce, etc.

Soraida tells us that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, and that she feels good, accomplished, more independent and responsible. She tells us that her daughter (who is sick) is her main motivation to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Soraida pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotras, vive en el Jr. Adolfo Morey 644, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos que son su adoración y aun dependen de ella, su esposo es agente de seguridad en un tienda comercial. Gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega muy surtida en su propia casa, donde todos los días, después de llevar a sus hijos al colegio, atiende su negocio, el cual es muy concurrido por sus vecinos por que ofrece productos de calidad y con precios cómodos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.000, (US$ 335.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de aceite, 3 cajas de gaseosas, verduras, etc.

Soraida nos dijo que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y su familia, se siente bien, realizada, mas independiente y responsable. Nos dice que su hija (la cual se encuentra enferma) es su mayor fuerza para salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying various general store products. (Compra de productos variados (bodega).)

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juanita is married and has two children, one boy and one girl. She runs a convenience store in the Vila Reconciliación district of Managua. He store has been growing thanks to loans, and she needs another one to expand her business by purchasing more products and improve their quality.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Juanita es casada y tiene 2 hijos, un varón y una mujer. atiende una pulpería en el barrio Vila Reconciliación de Managua. Su pulpería ha ido creciendo debido a los créditos que Afodenic le ha otorgado, necesita el dinero pra expandir el negocio, planea comprar y aumentar la cantidad de artículos con este dinero

loans.use: Expand business by purchasing more products of improved quality

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Juana is 51 years old, finished junior high school, and has two children who are not dependents any more. She lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo Province, in the La Libertad Department. She works in the manufacturing of handmaD. artisanal shoes, and offers them to customers in different areas . She learned to do this from her husband, who worked at a factory.

Mrs. Maria Juana is a member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Valerosas" (courageous women). From her communal bank, she obtained her first loan of S/.300 (approximately US$100), with which she bought shoe soles, shoe forms, and leather.

With the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos for S./1,000 (approximately US $335), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy leather, adhesives, and soles to make the shoes she will sell in these new year celebrations and in the summer season. Her biggest dream is to have a large factory that has the necessary machinery and technology.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Juana tiene 51 años D. edad, estudió secundaria completa y tiene 2 hijos que ya no dependen D. ella. Vive en el Distrito D. La Esperanza D. la Provincia D. Trujillo del Departamento D. La Libertad. Se dedica a la fabricación artesanal D. calzado, aprendió a hacerlo D. su esposo quien trabajó en una fábrica; reparte el calzado a clientes D. diferentes zonas.

La señora María Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas” , en su banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) con los cuales compró suelas, hormas y cuero.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1,000 (aproximadamente $335) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará cuero, pegamentos y suelas para confeccionar calzado que venderá en estas fiestas D. fin D. año y en le temporada D. verano. Su mayor sueño es tener una fábrica granD. que cuente con la maquinaria y tecnología necesaria.

loans.use: Buying leather and other materials for manufacturing (Compra de cuero y otros materiales para confección.)

loans.name: Argentina 1 Group

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena is 24 years old. She has a general store in her home, with which she supports her parents with their living expenses. Each of the women in the group will use the loan to stock their respective business by buying merchandise wholesale to increase their sales and profit.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA MAGDALENA TIENE 24 AÑOS, TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES CON LA CUAL APOYA A SUS PADRES CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR. AMBAS SURTIRAN SUS NEGOCIOS CON LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR PARA AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS Y LAS GANANCIAS.

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise wholesale (INVETIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR)

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawa is 35 and takes care of three children. After having been in an accident, her husband is unable to work. Yawa takes care of her family alone with the income she earns from her small neighborhood resturant, which she has been running for over five years. She would like to enlarge her restaurant in order to welcome more customers, whose numbers are steadily growing. She would also like to diversify her menu.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Yawa est agée de 35 ans , avec 3 enfants en charge. Son mari est inapte suite à un accident. Seule Yawa s'occupe de la famille par le revenu d'un petit restaurant de quartier qu'elle gère depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle veut agrandir le cadre de son restaurant afin d'augmenter la capacité d'accueil de ses clients qui deviennent de plus en plus nombreux. Elle veut également diversifier son menu

loans.use: Improve her restaurant and diversify her menu

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria Maria is 43 years old, married and has two children. She works as a janitor during the day at a public school in Managua, but due to the low wages she started a business selling food in the evenings. However, the conditions of her sales stand doesn't provide her much growth because she doesn't have many clients. Gloria needs money to start repairing the roof so she can better attract customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Gloria Maria tiene 43 años, casada y con 2 hijos. Doña Gloria trabaja de día como conserje en un colegio público de Managua, pero debido a los bajos ingresos que este le genera se ha visto en la necesidad de montar un negocio de venta de comida por las noches, pero las condiciones en que está el lugar donde ella vende no le permite desarrollarse más debido a la falta de clientes. Ella necesita el dinero para empezar reparando el techo de este lugar y así brindar mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Repair the roof of food-sales stand

loans.name: Argentina 2 Group

texts.es:
Maria Etelvina is 25 years old, has two children, and her husband works in the corn fields. She works buying varied flowers wholesale and creating floral arrangements that are bought by the people in her community for special events. Her group-mates have different activities: Eloida has a shoe store, Caralampia sells chicken, Mariola has a general store, and Maria Teresa sells soft drinks. Each of them will invest their portion of the loan in buying merchandise for their own activity.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA ETELVINA TIENE 25 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA SIEMBRA DEL MAIZ, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA DE DIVERDAS FLORES NATURALES AL POR MAYOR Y POSTERIORMENTE CREA DIVERSOS ARREGLOS FLORALES, LOS CUALES COMPRA LA GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD PARA SUS EVENTOS ESPECIALES. SUS COMPAÑERAS DE GRUPO SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES DIFERENTES: ELOIDA TIENE UNA ZAPATERIA, CARALAMPIA VENDE POLLOS TROZADOS, MARIOLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y MARIA TERESA VENDE REFRESCOS. AMBAS CON LA PARTE DEL PRESTAMO INVERTIRAN EN EL INCREMENTO DE MERCANCIA PARA CADA ACTIVIDAD.

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise for each business (INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA CADA NEGOCIO)

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David is 32 years old, married and has three children. Little by little he has been constructing his home and has been able to raise it up with a lot of hard work. He works out of it as a wielder in the Villa Reconciliación district of Managua and wants to improve his living conditions by adding flooring to his home, since it currently is dirt.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

David A. tiene 32 años, es casado y con 3 hijos. Poco a poco ha ido construyendo su vivienda y ha logrado levantarla con mucho esfuerzo. Trabaja haciendo soldadura a domicilio en Villa Reconciliación y desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida, embaldosando el piso de su casa que actualmente es de tierra.

loans.use: Floor home/workshop

loans.name: Argentina 3 Group

texts.es:
Teresa is 33 years old and has three children. Together with her husband, Teresa has a shop in which they sell accessories for and repair bicycles, because these are widely used by the people in their community. The other women in her group have different activities: Catalina has a general store in her home; Maria Guadalupe and Antonia sell cosmetics and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

TERESA TIENE 33 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS, JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO TIENEN UN TALLER EN DONDE REPARAN Y VENDEN ACCESORIOS PARA BICICLETAS, YA QUE SON MUY UTILIZADAS POR LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD. SUS COMPAÑERAS DE GRUPO TIENE DIFERENTE ACTIVIDAD: CATALINA TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES, MARIA GUADALUPE Y ANTONIA SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES.

loans.use: Investing buying bycicle spare parts (INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE REFACCIONES PARA BICICLETA)

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Mr. Moussa Omorou B. is 27 and owns a kiosk where he sells music. This business earns him an income and allows him to be self-employed. He is not yet married, but he would like to be within the next few years. With this loan, he will increase his inventory of music to meet his customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Moussa Omorou B. est agé de 27 ans et est proprétaire d'un Kiosk pour vendre les fournitures de musique. Cette activité lui procure du revenu et s'autoemploi. Il n'est pas encore marié mais il prétend se marié dans les années à venir. Avec cet emprunt il va augmenter son stock de fournitures de musique pour le bien de sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of audio cassettes in Lomé to resell them at the local market

loans.name: Orlando Felipe

texts.es:
Orlando is 56 years old and originally from Chontales, Nicaragua. He moved to Managua looking for a better life for him and his family. He's married with two children and runs a convenience store. He's requesting a loan so he can increase his income by way of adding a wider variety of products. Specifically, Orlando wants to increase and improve his distribution of dairy products like cream and milk, which he personally prepares in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Orlando originario de Chontales, 56 años, emigró a la ciudad de Managua buscando garantizar una mejor vida para él y su familia. Casado y con 2 hijos tiene una pulpería y requiere un crédito para incrementar sus ingresos mediante la variedad de sus productos, además Don Orlando desea incrementar y mejorar la distribución que personalmente hace de productos lácteos como crema, leche y cuajada en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en Managua

loans.use: Purchase products to increase inventory

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
Marvin runs a small convenience store. He's 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children. To grow his business, Marvin needs to invest more resources into his store and purchase more products to supply it. He also wants to improve its looks by buying bricks for it. His wife works at home and helps with running the store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Marvin es un pequeño comerciante con 34 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa, como negocio posee una Pulpería. Como parte del crecimiento necesita invertir más en su pulpería y requiere comprar más productos para surtir el negocio, y además mejorar la imagen del mismo comprando ladrillos para el piso. Su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda con la administración de la pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase products for convenience store and bricks for remodeling.

loans.name: Maman

texts.fr:
Maman A. is a dedicated woman who has been selling yams at the market in Assahoun for eight years. She is 39 and a married mother of two children. The successful management of her business has allowed her to earn an income to help meet her family’s needs. She has been a FECECAV client for three years and has already received and repaid three loans. With this new loan, Maman would like to increase her working capital so she can build up her inventory and meet her customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Maman A. est une femme dévouée qui vend des ignames au marché d'Assahoun depuis 8 ans. Elle agée de 39 ans , mariée et mère de 2 anfants.
