Mrs. Hem S., age 20, works at a garment factory making on average about $1.60 per day.  Her husband would like to be a motor-taxi driver to increase the family’s income.  They have no children.  

She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business, which will enable him to earn around $2.50 each day in profit.  Her husband is pictured in the photo with the motorbike he would like to purchase to operate his business as Mrs. Hem S. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Malickkosim

texts.en: Malickkosim Z. lives in Mastchokh and he is married with two children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 and he recommends himself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mr. Z. has a business in rice selling. He is the direct supplier which allows him to sell the rice by a price that is lower than the bazaar price. He is very polite which is why he has permanent clients who want to buy only his goods. Malickkosim Z. is very experienced in his business. But working in the trade sphere he meets hard competitors which is why he wants to widen his existing assortment. Now Mr. Z. requires a loan of 4100 STJ to develop his business and widen his assortment of goods  to increase the family's income that allows his children to continue their education.

loans.use: Malickkosim would like to develop his rice selling business so he can continue to send his children to school.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa B. lives in Mastchokh and she is married and has three children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004. She recommends herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She has been engaged in the business of selling food products. She has a wide assortment and many permanent clients (milk-sour products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products, etc). But working in the trade sphere she meets hard competitors which is why she wants to widen her existing assortment. Mrs. B. requires a loan of 1500 STJ to develop her business and widen her assortment of goods.

loans.use: Latifa would like to increase her assortment of goods for her food and goods store.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng O., 54, is a mother of eight children and is a widow.  She works running a stand at a market selling a wide variety of grocery products, earning about $3 a day in revenue.  One of her children works as a taxi driver, three are unemployed and the others are enrolled in school.  Mrs. Leng O. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory to offer more varieties of grocery products to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en: Jumagul Z. lives in Mastchokh and she is married and has two children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 and she recommends herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mrs. Z. is engaged in the business of selling children's and men's wear. She has a wide assortment. She is very polite which is why she has permanent clients who want to buy only her goods. She is very experienced in her business. But working in the trade sphere she meets hard competitors which is why she wants to widen her existing assortment. Now Mrs. Z. requires a loan of 2800 STJ to develop her business. She wants to widen her business to increase the family's income which allows her children to get a good education.

loans.use: Jumagul would like to develop her children's and men's clothing business.

loans.name: Ean

texts.en: Mrs. Ean H., 37, is a mother of three children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia.  She works selling Khmer cakes, earning on average about $3 each day, while her husband works as a construction foreman and typically makes about $3 per day.  Her three children are still too young to attend school yet.  Mrs. Ean H. hopes to use this loan to reinvest in her business, and use the remainder of the money to buy a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business and use the remainder of the money to buy a motorcycle for her family's transportation.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Your kiva loan has been repaid early.

Thank you for your support of Ean Hing. These loans greatly help contribute to the success of small businesses around the world. 

Best regards,
Isadora Tang
Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goods for her retail shop and salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of dried fish for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tea farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his working capital used for buying and selling livestock

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon M., 48, and her husband have been married for fifteen years. They have seven children. Five of them are studying, and the other two weave silk at home. Phon’s family lives on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Phon has been a weaver since she was 30 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband cannot work because of an illness. Phon hopes to continue to grow her weaving business so that she can support her children’s studies to the highest possible level.

Phon is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $150. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Houn D. (shown in the photo with her daughter) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Moeun, have been married since 1986. They have three children, two sons and one daughter. Houn’s two sons are studying in the local school, and her daughter has been weaving silk (see photo) at home since 2005. Their family lives along the Mekong River about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. Houn and her husband have been farming since 1986. They have been planting jicamas, yams, and sweet potatoes at a farm not far from their house.

Houn is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom for her daughter’s weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving and to pay for loom preparation

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Mrs. Yi K., 43, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia.  She and her husband run a butchery stand at a market, earning collectively about $4 a day in profit.

One of her children works grinding rice crops and the other three are enrolled in school.  Mrs. Yi K. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more pigs to meet her clients’ needs (as she mentioned, pork is now good to sell).

loans.use: To increase her inventory to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. Ly M., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhorn Phroeung, 35, have been married since 1989. They have four children, two sons and two daughters. Three of their children are studying in the local school, and the youngest one is at home. Ly’s home is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Ly is a construction contractor and has also done farming since 1992. Currently, he is growing vegetables on a farm a bit far from his home. His wife weaves silk at home. They both work hard to support their children’s studies to the highest possible level.

Ly is requesting his second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. He will use this loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for his farming business.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tea farming business.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat H., 45, and her husband, Mr. Leang Lonh, 49, have been married since 1980. They live in a small village along National Road Two, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have six children, three sons and three daughters. Three of their children are studying in the local school, two are working in a garment factory, and the other one is helping them to farm. Yat and her husband are farmers. Currently, they are planting cucumbers and squash on a farm in the village. They started their farming business in 1986.

Yat is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $600. She will use this loan to buy a water pumping machine and to dig a well for the farming business.

loans.use: To buy a water pumping machine and dig a well

loans.name: Sokoim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokoim K., 47, is a widow with five children: two sons and three daughters. Her family lives on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Two of her children are married and live in separate houses, and the other three live under her custody. One helps her sell sweets in the morning in front of her house, and the other two study in the local school. Sokoim has been a silk weaver since she was 20 years old. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor.

Sokoim is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her loom.

loans.use: To buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Thun

texts.en: Mrs. Thun S., 42, is married with five school-aged children.  She works raising pigs on her plot of land, earning around $2 each day.  Her husband is a photographer and generally makes about $3 each day.  Mrs. Thun S. hopes to use this loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs, and use the remainder of the money to buy a new camera for her husband.

loans.use: To expand her livestock by adding more pigs.

loans.name: Bimukarram

texts.en: Bimukarram is an experienced businesswoman as she has been engaged in trade for over 18 years. She is married and has two children. Her husband is unemployed and he has not had constant work. So she is the one who earns money for her family's needs. Her business is the trade of seeds and it is located in Panjshanbe food market, Khujand, Tajikistan. She buys her seeds from suppliers, who bring seeds from farm workers or from collective farms to the market to sell. She buys by large sacks (as you can see in the photo) and sells by retail. Her husband helps her lift her sacks from her warehouse in Panjshanbe to her trade place. Bimukarram says that during her work at the market she attracts a large number of clients and many of them buy her goods for fodder for their house animals. She has also attracted many clients from farther regions that come to purchase seeds from her. Her current turnover is fast and she wishes to purchase the biggest batch of seeds yet, as at the present time the price for seeds is cheaper during harvest gathering.

loans.use: Bimukarram would like to increasing the volume of her seeds to sell.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina S., 26, and her husband, Mr. Chhum Keo, 32, have been married since 2001. They have three sons, one of whom is attending the first year of primary school. Sina and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sina has been a silk weaver since she was 13 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband learned to weave silk from her in 2003 and started weaving silk in the same year. Now, he is a good silk weaver.

Sina is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $350. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her husband’s loom.

loans.use: To buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his milk selling business.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal U., 36, and her husband, Chanthoeun Noy, have been married since 1990. They have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are studying in the local school, and one of Sophal’s daughters is helping her weave silk at home. Sophal and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sophal has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her husband is a fisherman and also does farming. He also helps Sophal weave silk when he has free time.

Sophal is requesting her seventh loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $400. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials to continue her silk production and set up a new loom for her daughter. As Sophal has successfully repaid previous loans, we feel sure she will repay this new loan as well.

loans.use: To buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally T. (age 55) and his family live in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Phally and his wife, Heng Vung (see photo), were married in 1978 in a large group wedding arranged by the Khmer Rouge, who then held power. Phally went to school through the fourth grade, and Heng never attended school. They have seven children, all of whom still live at home with their parents. One daughter has a business as a hairdresser. Three still study in school.

Phally and his wife are requesting this, their third loan from MAXIMA, for $700 to buy a cart and a second horse. Phally will use the horses and cart to haul dirt used for fill on construction projects. In addition to the hauling business, they grow produce (squash) and are currently raising three cows. Heng also sells fish in the market in their village.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mr. Sar T. (age 67) and his family live in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sar and his wife, Chet Ror Keas, have been married since 1979. Sar attended school through the second grade, and his wife attended through the fifth. They have four living children; two died in infancy. Of the four still living, three live at home with their parents. The two youngest, both boys, still study in school. The eldest son works in Phnom Penh as a security guard.

They are requesting this, their second loan from MAXIMA, for $1,200 to buy a fishing boat and a boat motor. Sar has been fishing on the nearby Mekong River his entire life. Depending on the season, he fishes in a single boat with one of his sons using a smaller net. During the main fishing season from January through March, they use three boats and a big net. At that time he and his neighbor work together and hire up to ten men to work with them. In addition to taking care of the home and family, his wife sells the fish in the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and motor

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Mr. Math E. and his family live in a small village along the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Math (age 40) and his wife (age 38) have three children, all of whom live at home and attend school in their village. For many years before, Math fished in the nearby Mekong River. The catch has been declining for the past several years, so two years ago he and his wife started gathering recycling materials. They buy discarded household materials, which they then sort and resell to another, larger business in a nearby village. The business that buys their materials bundles them in bulk and then ships everything to Vietnam, a couple hundred kilometers to the east.

Of the materials Math and his wife collect, aluminum is the most valuable. They also buy and resell iron, steE., copper, hard plastics (such as PVC used in plumbing pipes), glass, paper, fiberboard, automotive batteries (for the lead inside), and any other items they can make some profit on. Math and his wife drive the lanes of their own and the neighboring villages gathering materials household by household. Math drives the motorbike and his wife sits behind holding the cart they pull (see photo). They don’t make much money doing this, but it does provide their main source of income. With luck, they hope to continue to work and buy a second-hand truck, which would allow them to carry more materials and drive farther.

Math and his family are requesting this, their second loan from MAXIMA, for $300 to buy discarded household materials.

loans.use: To purchase discarded materials for resale

loans.name: Bahtinisso

texts.ru:
Bahtinisso I. is 34 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 4 children. She plans to use her loan to purchase 2 pieces of livestock and feed for them. Bahtinisso has 2 years of experience in this area. Every 40-45 days she plans to sell the livestock and to use her revenues to purchase new livestock and feed. She will repeat this process over a 12 month period. At the end of the loan cycle, she plans to earn two pieces of livestock as profit. She will repay her loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Исмонова Бахтиниссо, возраст – 34 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота и корм для его откормки. Бахтиниссо имеет 2 года опыта в этом виде деятельности. Через каждиые 40-45 дней она планирует продавать скот и на вырученные деньги приобретать новый молодняк и корм для него. Куплей продажей она будет заниматься в течение 12 месяцев. По окончанию кредитного цикла клиент планирует получить в качестве прибыли 2 головы домашнего скота. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 pieces of livestock for feeding and resale

loans.name: Phoy

texts.en:
Ms. Phoy L. (age 33) lives in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Phoy has one daughter, who attends school in their village. Phoy herself never attended school. Phoy buys produce from farmers, which she then resells at a large market in Phnom Penh. Every day, Phoy leaves her village with her stock of vegetables at about 1:00 a.m., riding in a shared pickup truck. In Phnom Penh, she sells her produce to retailers, and then she returns home by about 5:00 a.m. She has been doing this for ten years and often sleeps only four hours a night.

In the attached photo, Phoy is bundling the leaves of the “kon tuit” (starfruit) tree. Cambodians eat these with some fish dishes.

Phoy is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA for $400, to buy produce from farmers to resell at the market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase produce for resale in Phnom Penh

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru:
Sojida K. is 27 years old, is single, has a secondary technical education and is a teacher by profession. She works as a teacher at school #18 in the Yavan region. She also has 4 years of experience in raising livestock.

Sojida plans to use her loan to purchase 3 pieces of livestock and feed for them. Every 40-45 days she plans to sell the livestock and to use the revenues to purchase new livestock and feed. Sojida plans to use leftover revenues to help her family as the family is large and not everyone has a source of income. Her brother helps her in her business. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Соджида, возраст – 27 лет, образование среднее техническое, по специальности – педагог, не замужем. В настоящее время она работает преподователем в средней школе №18 Яванского района. Также имеет четырехлетний опыт в разведение крупного роагтого скота. Полученный кредит хочет использовать на приобретение 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и корма для них. Через каждые 40-45 дней планирует продавать его, а на вырученные деньги приобретать новый молодняк и корм для него. Оставшуюся прибыль она планирует использовать на оказание помощи своей семье, так как семья у них большая и не все имеют источники получения дохода. В этой деятельности ей помогает ее брат. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 pieces of livestock

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mr. Seng S. and his family live in a small village along the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Seng (age 45) and his wife (age 47) have three children, one of whom attends school in their village. The two oldest live at home and work in a nearby plywood factory. Seng has been farming for about ten years. He learned with the help of a neighbor. His main crops are two varieties of greens – one similar to mustard greens (see photo), and another that is a type of lettuce. They also have a small grove of banana trees. A local middleman buys their produce and sells it at one of the large markets in Phnom Penh.

Seng and his family are requesting this, their third loan from MAXIMA, to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for their farm. They are requesting a loan of $100.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mordern cooking equipments and cooking ingredients for his kiosk.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy P., 41, and her husband, 45, have been married since 1984. They have six children, three sons and three daughters. One of Thavy's daughters is married and weaves silk at home, one of her sons is working in a restaurant in Phnom Penh, and the other children are studying. Thavy and her family are living in a small house on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a wooden house repairer. He learned his skill in 1985 and started work that year.

Now Thavy is in the process of building a new house. After getting loans from Maxima many times, Thavy has been able to save some money. Now she is requesting her fourth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will add this loan to the money she has saved to build her house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha P., 57, is a widow with three children: one son and two daughters. Her only son does farming at a farm not far from home, and both of her daughters weave silk at home. Pha and her children live on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since she was young. It's a skill she learned from her mother.

Pha is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Nasimhon

texts.ru:
Nasimhon M. is 49 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 4 children. He plans to use the loan to purchase two pieces of livestock, which he plans to feed and sell. He has been raising livestock for 15 years. Because it is currently hard to find steady employment, this business lets Nasimhon provide for his needs. He plans to use revenues from the sale of the livestock to purchase new livestock and feed and after 40-45 days to start the process again.

Nasimhon plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Менгалиев Насимхон, возраст – 49 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. На полученный кредит клиент хочет приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, который планирует откормить и продать. Разведением домашнего скота Насимхон занимается уже в течение 15 лет. Так как в настоящий момент очень трудно найти постояное место работы, для Насимхона такой вид деятельности является источником приносящий прибыль, позволяющий ему удовлетворять свои человеческие потребности. На вырученные деньги от продажи скота он планирует покупать молодняк и корм для его откормки и после 40-45 дней продавать его. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock for resale

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Lorm, 46, is a widow with two children: one son and one daughter. Her son is married and living in a separate house. Her daughter (photographed with her) is also married and lives with her mother. Lorm has been a silk weaver for many yeas. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her daughter is also a silk weaver, and her son-in-law is a security guard at a company in Phnom Penh.

Lorm is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $700. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials to continue with her silk production, and to buy a motorbike for her son-in-law to use to go to work.

loans.use: To buy silk materials and buy a motorbike

loans.name: Zarobiddin

texts.ru:
M. Zarobiddin is 45 years old, has higher education and a mechanic by profession. He is married and has 3 children. Zarobiddin's main work place is a joint-stock company "Ato" where he operates a press machine. Besides his job he is also raising cattle at his home which he has been doing for 3 years. With his loan, Zarobiddin plans to purchase 2 heads of cattle and food for them and then sell them after 40-45 days of feeding. He will use his profit to buy more young cattle and food to sustain them. During the 12 months, he will buy, feed and sell cattle and at the end of the loan term he estimates he will make a profit of 3 heads of cattle. Zarobiddin is planning to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Миров Заробиддин, возраст – 45 лет, образование высшее, по специальности механик, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Основным местом работы Заробиддина являетя Акционерное Общество Закрытого тиипа «Ато», в должности прессовщика. Помимо этого он также занимается разведением курпного рогатого скота у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота и корма для них, которые после откормки, через 40-45 дней будет продавать. На вырученные деньги он будет покупать новый молодняк и корм для его содержания. Куплей, откормкой и продажей крупного роагтого скота он будет заниматься в течение 12 месяцев, в конце кредитного цикла клиент планирует получить прибыль в количестве 3 голов крупного рогатого скота. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase two heads of cattle for breeding and sale

loans.name: Suraye

texts.ru:
N. Suraye is 26 years old and has secondary education. Suraye is an entrepreneur, she lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube and sells warm winter clothes. She has own stand in the central market of Qurgan-Tube. She plans to use her loan to purchase a new assortment of children's winter clothes. She brings in the merchandise from Dushanbe. The loan will help Suraye offer a wider variety of goods to the residents of Qurgan-Tube, which will give them more choices to match their tastes at a lower price. They would not have to travel outside of the city and spend extra money for the trip. She plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нахшбандова Сурайе, возраст – 26 лет, образование среднее. Сурайе предприниматель, живет в городе Курган-Тюбе и занимается продажей зимних теплых вещей. Она имеет торговую лавку на центральном рынке города Курган-Тюбе. На полученный кредит Сурайе планирует приобрести новый ассортимент зимних детских теплых вещей. Товар она привозит из города Душанбе. Получив кредит она сможет предложить жителям города Курган-Тюбе большой ассортимент продаваемого товара, чтоб они смогли выбрать его на свой вкус и приобрести по умеренным ценам, при этом не выезжая за пределы городы и не неся дополнительных расходов по проезду. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase new warm winter clothes

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Yean, 59, and her husband have been married since 1964. They have seven children--three sons and four daughters. Two of her sons were married and living separate houses and the other son is a tailor. Three of her daughters are weavers and the other one is selling sweets in her village. Yean and her family are living in a village along Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since 1964. It's a skill she learned from her sister-in-law. Her husband is a farmer.

She is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1000. She will use this loan to purchase silk material for continuing her silk production business. As Yean has successfully repaid previous loans, we feel sure she will repay this new loan as well.

loans.use: Rebuilding house

loans.name: Krut

texts.en:
Mr. K. Krut, 63, and his wife, Mrs. Aum Ram, 57, have been married since 1969. They have seven children; two sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and living in different houses. One of his sons does construction work with him and the other three children are studying in local school. Krut’s home is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has been a construction contractor since 2000 and does farming since he was young. His wife is doing farming too. They both work hard for supporting their children’s studies to the highest possible level. After getting loans from Maxima many times, his life is getting better and better.

Now he is requesting his fifth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $700. He will use this loan to buy materials for construction work and buying fertilizer and pesticides for farming business.

loans.use: Buying materials for construction work and buying fertilizer and pesticides for farming

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en: Hosiyat successfully repaid her first loan from the KIVA program. She also told all of her friends about KIVA and because of her, many of them became clients of our organization as well. You may know that Hosiyat was married and has four children. She has been engaged in trade for over 8 years and her business is selling clothing and shoes (sport). Presently she is selling her autumn assortment. She wishes to take part in a KIVA loan again and she is requesting a loan for the urgent purchase of winter goods to sell, before the New Year holiday.

loans.use: Hosiyat would like to increase the volume of winter goods for her clothing and shoe store before the New Year.

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Sokhum (age 49) is a widow with six children; four sons and two daughters. One of her children has been married and is living in a different house. The other five are living under her custody, four of which are working in garment factory, and the other one stays at home. Sokhum’s home is along National Road number Five about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of a grocery store and selling vegetables at her house since 2004. She buys grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh and vegetables from her village for reselling at her store. She and her children work hard to save some money to build new house. After getting loans from Maxima many times, her life is getting better and better.

Now she is requesting her fourth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1000. She will use this loan to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: Buying grocery items for reselling.

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.ru:
S. Bahriddin is 24 years old, he has secondary education. Bahriddin has his own automobile which he uses as a taxi to provide trasportation services to the residents of Qurgan-Tube. He has been in this business for the past 3 years. He plans to use his loan to purchase gas equipment and install it in his vehicle to make it run on natural gas. The prices for gasoline are constantly growing and it becomes very expensive for the residents to travel by taxi, as well as for Bahriddin himself. He does not have as many clients as before because of the rising costs. Installing this equipment will help greatly lower the costs of taxi fare. Gas fuel is much cheaper than petrol so it will give the residents an affordable option to get to their destinations because there's no public transportation in the city. Bahriddin plans to pay off his loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Садыков Бахриддин, возраст – 24 года, образование среднее. Бахриддин имеет свой собственный автомомобиль на котором оказывает услуги такси жителям города Курган-Тюбе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести газовое оборудование и установить его на свой автомобиль. Так как цены на бензтин ежедневно растут стоимость проезда в такси стает накладным для жителей данного района и для Вахриддина самого также, клиентов становится все меньше, потому что не всем стает это по карману. Установка газового оборудование поможет намного снизить стоимость проезда в такси. Это топливо намного дешевле бензина и даст возможность жителям города добираться до нужного пункта назначения, так как в городе остутсвует городской транспорт для передвижения. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and installation of gas equipment

loans.name: Youn

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Youn, 36, and her husband have been married since 1988. She has three children; two sons and one daughter. Her first son is in business in raising ducks, her daughter is working in a garment factory, and her youngest son is studying in local school. Youn and her family are living along National Road number Five about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of a grocery store and selling vegetables at her house since 2003. Her husband does growing rice. She tries to save some money from her income to buy cows for her husband to grow rice. After getting loans from Maxima many times, her life is getting better and better.

Now she is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $250. She will use this loan to buy grocery items for reselling in her grocery store.

loans.use: Buying grocery items for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his clothing business.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Mr. R. Sarin and his wife have been married since 1987.  They have seven children, five of whom study in primary school in their village. One of his sons is assisting him in driving moto-remolque taxi and one of his daughters is working in a garment factory. Sarin and his family is living along National Road Two about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. He is in the business of transportation. He drives a moto-remolque taxi. Closer to Phnom Penh, National Road Two is lined with garment factories. At each shift change, thousands of workers, mostly women, need to be ferried to and from the surrounding villages.  Cambodians use the moto-remolque, a very economical combination of a trailer pulled by a 100 or 125cc motorbike. They typically hold as many as eighteen or more people. Sarin is requesting a loan from Maxima with the amount of $500. He will use this loan to exchange his motorbike for moto-remolque transportation.

loans.use: Buying new motorbike for moto-remolque (trailer) taxi

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married with two daughters. She and her family live in Vasilyevka. Elvira sells nice, quality clothing in a big local market. Her family is actively helping her with her business which she started about 3 years ago, and her current gross income is about $2000.

Elvira would like to ask for a loan of $1000 to increase her inventory stock which will help supply her until the spring season. She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Elvira’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with an 11-year-old daughter. They live in Zaporozhye. Larisa sells cosmetics at the local Krytiy market (covered market). Her small vending stall is well-known in the market for reasonable prices and a nice arrangement of inventory. She has been in this family business for 8 years, and Larisa’s current turnover capital is about $600.

Larisa can always see potential where others don’t see any opportunity. She finds ways to get things done when others don’t think it can be done. Her passion for business shows in everything she does. Larisa would like to request a loan of $1000 to increase on stock and buy cosmetics wholesale. We believe her enterprising spirit will motivate Larisa to follow up on her business ideas.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tea farming business.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with a grown son. Her family lives in Nikopol. Nataliya sells terry robes and men’s and women’s undergarments in the central market of Nikopol. She has a wide variety of merchandise combined with reasonable prices. Nataliya has been in this trade for 9 years, and presently, her turnover capital is about $1000.

Nataliya is trying to do everything she can to provide for her family and give her son a decent education. That is why she wants to continue expanding her business and growing her trade by increasing the number of her vending locations. Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1000 to sustain her business and help ensure it continues to provide enough income to live on.

loans.use: To open a new vending spot

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg supports his wife and two children with a small office supplies business in the little village of Pocrovskoe near Nicopol, Ukraine. Oleg has been in business for about seven years. He has a good location near the center of town and has benefited from not having direct competition from other vendors.

Oleg has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase a new supply of inventory for his business. He has proven to be a hard-working entrepreneur who has been able to develop a stable, growing business. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist him in continuing the success of his business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga owns a successful clothing and shoe sales business located at the Victoria market in Nicopol, Ukraine. She has been selling in the market for about seven years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Olga tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. A normal monthly income from her business is around $600. Olga is married and has two kids, and her business is a good source of income for her family.

Olga has requested a loan of $1200 to increase her product inventory. This is a busy time of the year for many market vendors as people purchase new winter clothing and get ready for the upcoming New Year and Christmas holidays. By purchasing additional inventory, Olga will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a single mother with a grown son. She lives in Zaporozhye and owns a vending business at the Angolenka market. Tatyana sells bedding, children’s clothing, and household items. She has been in this trade for 11 years. Presently, she has about $900 in turnover capital.

Tatyana has an entrepreneurial mind that is always lively, active, constantly calculating, and always on the lookout for the next big opportunity. Her business is profitable and stable, however, she would like to press on and expand it even more. Today, Tatyana is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her stock and meet the growing demand from this Christmas season.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a single mother with one son. She lives in Vasilyevka and works in the local food market, selling baked goods and sweets. Victoria’s stall is well-known for having a wide assortment of inventory and low prices. Being a smart manager of her resources and educated with a degree in pedagogy, she has been able to start and sustain her small business over the last 5 years. Today, Victoria has about $3000 in inventory.

Victoria is very energetic. She balances her business activities, teaching in a local middle school, and her family responsibilities. Victoria is very serious about every single thing she takes on. She is very determined to further her entrepreneurial goals and dreams, which is why she is now requesting a loan of $500. She is hoping to open a new vending location and widen the assortment of goods for sale in her vending kiosks.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena S. lives in Nikopol. She sells seasonal footwear at the central city market. Yelena’s grandmother used to work in the market selling clothing, and encouraged her granddaughter to start her own venture too. Yelena has been in this business for two years now, and her business is characterized by high quality merchandise and a favorable location. Presently, her turnover capital is about $800.

Yelena would like to receive a loan of $600 to open a new vending facility, purchase new merchandise wholesale, and increase her turnover capital. She wants to generate additional profit to provide for the needs of her family and eventually build up enough savings to purchase her own private apartment. Yelena is very optimistic. She never gives up, but presses on and remains perseverant in everything she does. Her natural ability to achieve set goals will help her repay this current loan.

loans.use: To open a new vending spot

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rice and blinds for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his fish selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the municipal licence and add stock for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Boost his alternative business splitting timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his small scale farming and barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fruit business and buy a blender

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her milk business

loans.name: Delia Dalila

texts.es:
Delia is 41 years old and takes care of her 2 children. She studied up until the fourth year of secondary school, and she lives in the district of La Esperanza. She sells plastics, china plates, clothing, slippers, etc, often by the request of people she knows. She not only sells her products in the different villages in the foothills of La Libertad, but also around the city of Trujillo. Delia is a member of the communal bank called Mujeres Valerosas, which provided her first loan of approximately $100 to launch her business. With the new loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more china plates, summer clothing, and Christmas novelties to sell during the holiday season. She would like to secure her own stand in a well known central market, so she doesn't have to sell her products in the street.

La señora Delia tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que aun están a su cargo. Estudió hasta el cuarto año de secundaria, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Liberad y actualmente se dedica al comercio ambulatorio; vende plásticos, platos de loza, ropa, zapatillas, etc., muchos de éstos son pedidos que le hacen sus conocidos, a parte recorre diferentes pueblos de la sierra de La Libertad para vender sus productos y también diferentes zonas de la ciudad de Trujillo. La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas”, en él obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100), este préstamo le sirvió para poder surtir su negocio. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000.00 (aproximadamente $335), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará platos de loza, ropa de verano y adornos navideños para vender en esta temporada de fiestas navideñas. La señora Delia anhela tener un puesto en un centro comercial conocido y así evitar vender por las calles.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CHINA PLATES, CLOTHING AND CHRISTMAS NOVELTIES TO SELL AND GROW HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Sandra Evarista

texts.es:
Sandra Evarista sells clothing to wholesalers and other small businesses along the streets of Chinandega. She has been running this business for 4 years, starting with some of her own savings. Since she began working with CEPRODEL 3 years ago, she has received 12 small loans which have helped her cover basic costs for her children and family in general, while she has grown her business thanks to the loans received.

Sandra Evarista, es una mujer que su trabajo en si era Vendedor Ambulante (vendía en las calles de Chinandega), vendía Ropa al por mayor a otros pequeños Comerciantes.

Tiene cuatro años en el manejo de su negocio y su monto inical fué de C$ 8.000.00 Cordobas netos, de ese monto inicial incluye Capital propio, parte de sus ahorros.

Sandra Evarista, desde que comenzo a trabajar con Ceprodel desde hace 3 años ha obtenido 12 créditos , los cuales han sido para cubrir los gastos basicos para su hijos y familia en general.

Desde que ella comenzo a trabajar con Ceprodel la actividad de su negocio ha ido aumentando, y ahora se dedica a la Compra de Mercaderia en General, gracias a la oportunidad de crédito que obtuvo con Ceprodel.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY MORE  MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING SALES BUSINESS.

loans.name: Rodiah

texts.en: Rodiah is 34-year-old woman who sells chicken livestock from her home. She feeds and raises them before selling them. She usually earns US$16 per day. Her husband, R., has no regular income. She requests a loan to buy more chicks to expand her business.  She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida lives in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali, and is part of the group belonging to the Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, (communal bank of the triumphant leaders). She is 49 years old and has 4 grown up children. She is separated from her husband, which was one of the motivations for starting her own business so she could cover the costs of her home.

Elida runs a small restaurant from her house. She sells lunches every day and in the afternoon she prepares delicious cakes and pastries which everybody loves. Every day she gets up very early to get to the market to buy the necessary items to prepare her meals, resting only after much hard work and then preparing for the next day.

With the loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy sodas, gelatin and sweets, rice and sugar, investing the rest in the daily meals. Elida told us that she feels good, and has no problem working so hard. Thanks to the loans, she can work without worry and see that her business is growing every day.

La señora Elida pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr Rosa Merino 168, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y todos son mayores de edad. Está separada, motivo por el cual decidió poner un negocio para los gastos del hogar. Gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) pudo instalar un negocio de venta de comida, golosinas, gelatinas, flanes, gaseosas y kekes. En la actualidad ella tiene un restaurante en su propia casa, vende menú todos los días, y por las tardes prepara sus gelatinas, tortas, flanes (postres), que son muy ricos y sabrosos, y son las delicias de sus vecinos. Cada día se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los insumos que va a necesitar para la preparación de sus comidas y demás antojitos que vende, y después de una ardua labor ella descansa para seguir con mas fuerzas para el día siguiente. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000, (US$ 1,004.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses. Invertirá S/. 300 en gaseosas, S/. 30 en flan y gelatinas, S/. 50 en golosinas, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar e invertirá S/. 90 soles diarios en la comida del día. Elida nos dijo que se siente bien, no tiene ningún problema y trabaja sin ninguna novedad gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos y los prestamos obtenidos, puede trabajar tranquila y ve que su negocio crece cada día más.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SODAS, SWEETS, SUGAR, RICE AND OTHER ITEMS NEEDED TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SERVES IN HER SMALL RESTAURANT.

loans.name: Nidia Marlene

texts.es:
Small business owner Nidia Marlene is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children who all attend school. For two years she has had a small restaurant where she offers breakfasts, lunches and snacks. With her good location on a busy street, her business is good. In these two years she been able, little by little, to buy a refrigerator, kitchen utensils and tables and chairs. However, she is requesting a loan to be able to buy more products, including sodas, juices, bottled water, chicken, pork, vegetables and other items.

La microempresaria Nidia Marlene S. G. tiene 39 años de edad es casada con 3 hijos, todos estudian, 2 en primaria y 1 secundaria, es originaria de Bluefields. Esta señora desde hace 2 años tiene un comedor en el cual oferta desayunos, fritos, vigoron y reposteria. Por la ubicacion del su negocio esta microempresaria vende bastante sus productos ya que se encuentra en una avenida bien visitada. En estos 2 años a estado comprando poco a poco su refrigeradora, su cocina y otros utencilios de cocina al igual que mesas y sillas. Sin embargo cuenta con poco capital para la compra de sus productos para lo que esta persona necesita de un financiamiento. La cajas de Gaseosas de 2 litros le cuesta US$ 8.00, la caja de gaseosas pequeñas esta valorada en US$500, la caja de jugos cuesta 8.00, la caja de agua purificada cuesta US$ 7.00, la caja de gaterade cuesta US$ 13.00, la libra de pollo cuesta US$ 1.00, la libra de cerdo cuesta US$ 1.30, la libra de res cuesta US$ 1.70, la libra de verduras cuesta US$ 0.40 y la vitrina para reposteria esta valorada en US$ 130.00.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SODAS, CHICKEN, PORK, VEGETABLES AND OTHER ITEMS FOR HER SMALL RESTAURANT.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $91.17 dólares.
La cuota correcta es de US$ 91.17 dolares.
La cuota completa es de US$ 91.17

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elsa is a member of a communal bank called Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotros. She lives in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 62 years old and separated from her husband, but the support she receives doesn't cover everything. She used her first loan to begin selling meals and drinks.

She gets up at dawn to prepare her food. She takes it to her stand where her customers wait for her to arrive with her delicious meals. In the afternoons she sells sweets from her home. With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy rice, oil, sugar, noodles, as well as other items.

Even though she suffered a tragedy when her only son died, she had the strength to continue. She told us that life gives her happiness and also pain, and the greater they are, there is also always a ray of hope and a reason to live. In Manuela Ramos she has found friends with whom she can share moments of happiness.

La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotras, vive en el Jr. Ocatavio Monte Verde 437, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es separada, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Elsa, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la venta de comidas y golosinas. Actualmente Elsa se levanta de madrugada para preparar sus comidas y dirigirse a su puesto de venta donde sus clientas esperan con ansias su llegada por las ricas comidas que a diario prepara, y en la tardes vende golosinas en la esquina de su casa. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.500, (US$ 502.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 sacos de arroz, 1 galones de aceite, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de fideos, además invertirá S/. 50 soles diarios en la compra de otros insumos y S/. 30 en golosinas. Elsa, a pesar de haber perdido a su único hijo, tuvo fuerzas para seguir adelante, nos dijo que la vida te da alegrías pero también penas y que por más grandes que sean, siempre hay una luz de esperanza y una razón de vivir, en Manuela Ramos encontró muchas amigas con las cuales comparte lindos momentos de alegría.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ITEMS SUCH AS RICE, OIL, SUGAR, NOODLES AND SWEETS TO CONTINUE RUNNING HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.es:
Ethel is part of the communal bank called Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas. She lives in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 61 years old, widowed, and has 10 grown children, the oldest of whom are now independent and have their own families. Two of her children live with her, they are her company and her greatest treasure. Thanks to the first loan she was able to start a business buying and selling bronze and aluminum pipes. Ethel has her stand in the central market of Tacorita, where we find her every day, serving her customers with her charismatic smile and good customer service. She gets up very early each day, telling us that God helps those who get up early!

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase more tubes in bronze, iron and aluminum. Ethel tells us that thanks to the loans, her business has grown. She now has a small, well stocked shop and she feels very happy because all of her children are healthy and happy.

La señora Ethel pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en el Jr Sánchez Cerro 390, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 10 hijos D. las cuales los mayores ya son independientes y han formado su propia familia, pero con ella aun quedan dos que son su compañía y su tesoro mas preciado. Gracias al primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 (US$ 100.00) deciD. invertir en la compra y venta D. tubos, bronce y aluminio. En la actualidad ella tiene su puesto en Tacorita puesto 29 (Mercado D. la zona), donD. la podemos encontrar todos los días para que nos atienda con su carismática sonrisa y buen trato, ella se levanta muy temprano por que nos dijo que .. "al que madruga Dios le ayuda". Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 2,000, (US$ 662.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 docena D. tubos, ½ docena D. bronce, 5 docenas D. fierros y 10 docenas D. aluminio. Ethel, nos dijo que gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio creció, ya que pudo implementar y tener hasta la actualidad un almacén muy surtido y se siente una mujer muy feliz porque tiene a todos sus hijos sanos y felices.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TUBES OF ALUMINUM, IRON AND BRONZE FOR HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Surtinah

texts.en: Surtinah is 32-year-old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can earn US$44.50 per month, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Surtinah requests a loan to fil her shop. Her husband, L., has no regular income, so she has to work hard for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva is part of the communal bank called Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas. She lives in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 53 years old and has 6 children, all of whom are grown up and working, and appreciate very much the sacrifice their mother maD. for them. Her husband is a shop assistant, but his salary is not enough to cover the costs of the house. With the first loan, Genoveva invested in a business selling clothing and food.

She sells clothing door to door, and in the evenings she prepares and sells food such as roasted chicken, rice dishes and snacks which her neighbors love and wait for every day. Genoveva gets up very early each day to go sell her clothing and still have time to prepare her meals in the afternoon.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy chickens, rice and potatoes, as well make some minor repairs to her kitchen. Genoveva tell us that things are going very well. Her business has grown and she has maD. new friends through the communal bank. She feels good about herself.

La señora Genoveva pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en el Jr Urubamba 650, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 53 años D. edad y es madre D. 6 hijos, todos profesionales y muy agradecidos con ella por todo el sacrificio que hizo por ellos y que nunca olvidaran. Su esposo es trabajador dependiente, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Genoveva, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) deciD. invertir en la compra - venta D. ropa y venta D. comidas. En la actualidad ella venD. ropa a domicilio y se dedica a la venta D. comida por la noches, prepara salchipapas, pollo broaster, arroz chaufa (comida rápida) que son las delicias D. sus vecinos y que todos los días esperan con ansias que Genoveva salga a vender para poder degustar tan ricos platos. Se levanta muy temprano todos los días para ir a vender sus prendas a sus clientas y en la tarD. preparar los alimentos que venD.. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,500, (US$ 502.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará D. 6 pollos, 5 kilos D. arroz y 15 kilos D. papa, además dará mantenimiento a su cocina. Genoveva, nos dijo que le va muy bien, su negocio ha crecido y gracias a Manuela Ramos hizo mas amistades y se siente bien consigo misma.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CHICKEN, RICE AND POTATOES TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SELLS, AS WELL AS MAKE SOME MINOR REPAIRS TO HER KITCHEN.

loans.name: Gloria Roxana

texts.es:
Gloria is part of the communal bank called Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas. She lives in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 42 years old and has 4 children who depend on her. Her husband is a wood carver, but his salary is not enough to cover the household costs. With the first loan, Gloria decided to invest in a small shop. She set up the shop in her home and it's very well located. She serves all her customers with the help of her children, who support her and let her know they appreciate the efforts she makes for them.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, sodas, milk, salt and other every day grocery items. Gloria told us that the loans are a great help for many women who want to start their own business and improve their financial situation. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to achieve many things which have benefited her family.

La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en el Jr Sánchez Cerro 350, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos que aun depende de ella, su esposo es cubicador de madera (operario), pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos familiares, es así que Gloria, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propia casa y está muy bien surtida. Atiende a todos sus clientes con la ayuda de sus hijos que siempre están ahí para apoyarla y agradecerle el gran esfuerzo que hace por ellos. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000, (US$ 669.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará de 1 saco de arroz, 2 cajas de gaseosa, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, 1 saco de sal, pasamanería, entre otras cosas (abarrotes). Gloria nos dijo que Manuela Ramos es una gran ayuda para muchas mujeres que quieren emprender su propio negocio y mejorar su economía, gracias a eso ella pudo realizar muchas cosas que tanto quería hacer para el beneficio de su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUGAR, RICE, MILK, SALT AND OTHER DAILY GROCERY ITEMS FOR HER SMALL SHOP.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Mrs. Silvia C. lives in her uncle’s home on Pinocho street in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. She is a street vendor who sells candy and cookies around the nearby schools. She is requesting a loan in order to buy toys. She intends to broaden her business this Christmas season in order to generate more revenue because this business is her sole source of income.

Because of her good credit history, she is able to request a new loan. She has been a member of IMPRO since the beginning of the year and has already paid off her previous debts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Silvia vive en casa de sus tíos en la calle Pinocho de la zona de las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la venta de dulces y galletas ambulando en los colegios. El crédito que solicita es para comprar juguetes. Para la época de navidad Silvia amplia su actividad para generar más ingresos ya que es su único medio de subsistencia.

Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que su historial de pagos es muy bueno. Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el comienzo de este año y ya recibió dos créditos anteriores los cuales han sido cancelados en su totalidad

loans.use: Purchase of toys for her business

loans.name: Leyli

texts.es:
Mrs. Leyli is part of the “Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras”, she lives on Jr. Rosa Merino Mz. H Lt. 40, of Calleria District, Ucayali province. She is 40 years old. She is the mother of 2 small children. Her husband works in construction, but the salary he receives isn’t enough to cover family costs. That’s how Leyli decided to invest in a general store with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles ($100US).

Currently, she has a big store with great variety. She told us that she began by selling candy on a board and now she is the owner of a general store. She also has a food selling business with her mother in the evenings. Every day, they prepare the food together that they sell in the house.

With the current loan of 2,500 soles ($837US approx.) she’s received from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid back in 6 months, she’ll buy 2 bags of rice, 3 bags of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 1 box of gelatin, 1 packet of detergent, a dozen bars of soap, 1 box of oil, etc. The rest of the loan will go toward the food sales.

Leyli is happy that her business if growing because she can give her family economic stability and educate her children. She feels comfortable working with her mother and to all women she says, go ahead and invest in your own business and look to Manuela Ramos for support.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

. La señora Leyli pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr Rosa Merino Mz. H Lt. 40, del distrito Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo es maestro de obras (construcción), pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos familiares, es así que Leyli, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en una bodega. En la actualidad ella tiene una bodega grande y bien surtida, nos contó que ella empezó vendiendo golosinas en un tablero y ahora es dueña de una bodega. También tiene un negocio de venta de comida, está asociada con su mama y realizan esta actividad por las noches, juntas preparan los alimentos que a diario venden en su casa. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500, (US$ 837.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, 1 caja de gelatina,1 paquete de detergente, 1 docena de jabón, 1 caja de aceite, etc., y otra parte del préstamo lo destinará para el negocio de venta de comida. Leyli se siente contenta, su negocio esta creciendo, puede darles estabilidad económica a su familia y educación a sus hijos. Se siente muy cómoda trabajando con su madre y dice a todas las mujeres que no duden en invertir en su propio negocio y que busquen el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products for her store.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
María belongs to the communal bank Luchando por Nosotras (Fighting for Us), and she lives on 10 Asentamiento Humano Telefónica Street in the Calleria district in Ucayali. She is 29-years-old and is the mother of a 1 1/2-year-old baby, who is her reason for living. Her husband works for a company, so he is absent a lot of the time. Thanks to the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles ($100), she decided to invest in buying and selling clothing.

Presently, she has a clothing store in her own house where she attends to her clients with a lot of happiness and enthusiasm. They can find garments in their size and style, and this is why María already has a lot of orders for the holidays.

With the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos of 1,200 nuevos soles (about $402), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 1 dozen undergarments, 1 dozen blouses, and 1 dozen pairs of pants. She will go to the city of Lima to buy this merchandise.

María told us that since receiving her first loan from Manuela Ramos, everything has gone very well for her and now more than ever because thanks to the loans, she has been able to accomplish many things for the benefit of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora María pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotras, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Telefónica Mz. E Lt. 10, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años de edad y es madre de un bebe de año y medio que es su motivo de vida. Su esposo trabaja en una compañía por lo que para mucho tiempo ausente. Gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la compra y venta de ropas.

En la actualidad tiene una tienda de venta de ropas instalada en su propio domicilio donde atiende a sus clientas con mucha alegría y entusiasmo, y ellas pueden encontrar las prendas de vestir a su medida y gustos, es por eso que Maria, para estas fiestas, ya tiene muchos pedidos que traer para complacer a sus clientas.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,200, (US$ 402.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 docena de ropa interior, 1 docena de blusas, 1 docena de pantalones, para eso viajará a la cuidad de Lima a comprar mercadería.

Maria nos dijo que desde su primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos todo le ha ido muy bien y ahora mas que nunca porque gracias a ello ha podido realizar muchas en beneficio de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Umsah

texts.en: Umsah is 38-year-old woman who has a food stall at her house, where she prepares and sells coconut milk rice and some crackers. She could earn US$7.50 per day. Unfortunately, her husband, R., has no fixed income. Umsah is a member of MBK and requests a loan to make her business sustainable and hopes that it will increase her income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To make her business sustainable

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.es:
Pacifica is a member of “Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras”. She lives at Jr. Cesar Vallejo 368, Calleria District, Province of Ucayali. She’s 58 years old and has 5 independent children – none of whom forget the great sacrifice she made for them -- and are always by her side. Her husband sells fish, but the salary isn’t enough to cover the basic living costs. That’s why when Pacifica received her first loan of 300 soles ($100US) from Manuela Ramos, she invested it in the sale of regional dishes.

She installed her regional food sales business in her house. But, she’s also thinking about investing, with her husband, in the buying and selling of fish. She wakes up early in the morning, makes breakfast and then heads for the market to buy the ingredients she needs for her dishes. In the evenings she works her business; she is nice and cordial with her customers.

With the loan she currently received from Manuela Ramos of 3,000 soles ($1,004US approx.), which will be paid back in 6 months, she’ll buy a table to fit all of the ingredients and a charcoal barbecue, 5 kilos of dried meat, 6 chickens, 3 kilos of chorizo sausage, 5 kilos of rice, 2 kilos of sugar, 10 kilos of pork, and vegetables to prepare the food she sells.

Pacifica is very happy and satisfied with everything she’s been able to accomplish so far, thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos. She told us that a woman should always be strong and above everything else, love herself.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Pacifica pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr Cesar Vallejo 368, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, todos independientes, quienes no olvidan el gran sacrificio que hizo por ellos y siempre están a su lado. Su esposo es comerciante de pesca, el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Pacifica, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la venta de comidas regionales.

El negocio de venta de comidas lo tiene instalado en su propia casa, pero también esta pensando invertir, junto a su esposo, en la compra y venta de pescados. Se levanta muy temprano para preparan el desayuno y luego se dirige al mercado para comprar los insumos que necesita para la preparación de sus comidas. Por las tardes se dedica a su negocio, su atención es cordial y amable.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 3.000, (US$ 1,004.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 mesa para la comodidad de sus comensales y una parrilla a carbón, 5 kilos de cecina, 6 pollos, 3 kilos de chorizo, 5 kilos de arroz, 2 kilos de azúcar, 10 kilos de chancho y verduras para la preparación de los alimentos que vende.

Pacifica se siente feliz y muy satisfecha por todo lo que esta logrando hasta ahora y gracias al apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos. Nos dijo que una mujer siempre debe ser fuerte y sobre todas las cosas quererse a sí misma.

loans.use: To buy ingredients. To buy a table. To buy a charcoal barbecue.

loans.name: Marsonah

texts.en: Marsonah is 43-year-old woman who produces cakes and sells them door-to-door around the village. She could earn US$7.50 per day. Her husband, L., has no fixed income. Marsonah requests a loan to expand her business to earn extra income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Enjun

texts.en: Enjun is 47-year-old woman who has a small food stall which sells snacks, candies, fruit, flavoured ice sticks, etc., and  usually earns US$5.50 per day. Her husband, N., has no fixed income. Enjun requests a loan to expand her business. She is a member and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is a refrigerator technician and lives in the Laureles Sur district. He is the only one who works and he supports his family. He would like to build a room for his children because the condition in which they now live is uncomfortable. He hopes that the new room will give them more comfort and improve their living situation.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Manuel es Técnico en refrigeración, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur. es el único que trabaja y es el que lleva el sosten a a su familia. Desea hacer un cuarto para uno de sus hijos, ya que las condiciones en que actualmente se encuentran es muy incómoda. Espera que el cuarto pueda brindarles un poco más de comodidad y mejorar las condiciones en que habitan.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a room.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silvia is a member of “Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras”. She lives at Jr. Urubamba 705, Calleria District, Province of Ucayali. She’s 34 years old and has 1 child who depends on her. Her husband is a computer technician, but his salary isn’t enough to cover the cost of living. That’s why Silvia decided to invest in the sales of clothing and tailoring with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles ($100US).

Currently she owns a small clothing store – she makes all of clothing herself. Her business is situated in her house where she takes care of the household duties by day and sews at night. Her clients are very satisfied and admire her designs and finishes.

With the recent loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 1,200 soles ($402US approx.), which will be paid back in 5 months, she’ll buy 200 soles worth of fabric, a computer, a sewing machine -- and to expand the business -- a darner, which she desperately needs. The remainder of the loan will be invested in the sale of food.

Silvia feels good working with Manuela Ramos and she has told us that she will move forward, God willing, with the unconditional support of her husband and the great love she feels for her son.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Silvia pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en el Jr Urubamba 705, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años de edad y es madre de 1 niño que aun depende mucho de ella, su esposo es técnico en computación, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos de la familia, es así que Silvia, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la venta de prendas de vestir y en la costura (servicio).

En la actualidad tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa que ella misma lo confecciona. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa, donde por las mañanas se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y en las tardes a la costura, sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos y les gusta sus diseños y acabados.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,200, (US$ 402.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará S/. 200 soles en telas, comprará una computadora, una maquina de coser y para ampliar mas el negocio comprará una máquina remalladora que tanto le hace falta. El saldo del préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio de venta de comida.

Silvia se siente muy bien trabajando con Manuela Ramos y nos dijo que si Dios quiere va a salir adelante, con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y el gran amor que siente por su hijo.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fabrics. To buy machinery and a computer.

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng is 34-year-old woman who has a small shop which sells snacks and some household goods. She usually earns US$5 per day with a small profit. Her husband, A., has no fixed income. Neneng requests a loan to buy more goods to fill her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Sapnah

texts.en: Sapnah is 52-year-old widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, so she has to work hard to cover her family's daily needs. She sells vegetables door-to-door around the village and earns US$11.50 per week. Previously, she sold food, but that business did not grow very well so she decided to focus on vegetable sales only.  She requests a loan to accomplish her goals and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani is 45-year-old woman. She is a tailor and usually earns a small income, just enough for the daily family needs. During the festive season, her profits could increase. Her husband, U., sells food and can earn US$5 per day.  Nanih requests a loan to expand her business and hopes that this will cover her children's tuition. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Adela De Jesus

texts.es:
Adela is a single mother and lives in the Hugo Chávez settlement. Adela is a small business woman and she runs her business out of her house. In the morning she sells fruits and vegetables and at night she sells prepared good. In this way Adela has been able to support her family. She needs money to finish building the front part of her humble abode and thus improve the presentation of her products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Adela es madre soltera y habita en el asentamiento Hugo Chávez. Adela es una pequeña comerciante y sus negocios los tiene ubicados en su casa, por las mañanas vende frutas y verduras y por las noches vende comida. Es de esta manera como Adela ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. Necesita el dinero para terminar de cosntruir la parte delantera de su humilde vivienda y así mejorar la presentación de sus negocios a sus clientes.

loans.use: To build the front part of her home

loans.name: Virginia Socorro

texts.es:
Virgina is a member of “Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas”. She lives at Jr. Urubamba 763, Calleria District, Province of Ucayali. She’s 50 years old and has 3 children, one of whom still lives with her and is the object of her adoration. Her husband is a driver, but his salary doesn’t cover their cost of living. That’s why Virginia invested in the sale of hardware with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles ($100US).

Currenlty, she sells hardware in her home and other places. She also sells other hardware items and she’s thinking about having her own hardware store in the future, God willing and with much effort. She told us that she will persevere because she who is persistent, perseveres. Every day she wakes up early to attend to her husband and son and then goes out to sell her products. In the afternoon, she attends her business at home and in the evening she’s with family.

With the current loan she’s received from Manuela Ramos of 2,600 soles ($870US approx.), which will be paid back in 5 months, she’ll buy 10 kilos of nails, 1 dozen hammers, half a dozen pliers, 20 iron pieces, half a dozen inner tube removers and other smaller items.

Virginia tells us that Manuela Ramos is the best for loans because thanks to her the business came to fruition. She and her family feel happy and are always giving thanks to our Lord for all things afforded them.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en el Jr Urubamba 763, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 50 años D. edad y es madre D. 3 hijos, solo uno está con ella y es su adoración. Su esposo es chofer (transportista), pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos familiares, es así que Virginia, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) deciD. invertir en la venta D. fierros.

En la actualidad ella desarrolla esta actividad en su domicilio, pero también venD. a otras partes.
