También venD. algunos materiales D. ferretería y piensa poner su propia ferretería, mas adelante si Dios quiere y con mucho esfuerzo. Nos dijo que lo logrará porque el que es perseverante lo logra. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender a su esposo e hijo y luego sale a ofrecer sus productos, en las tarD. atienD. en su casa y en la noche la pasa con su familia.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 2,600, (US$ 870.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará D. 10 kilos D. clavos, 1 docena D. martillo, ½ docena D. alicates, 20 unidades D. fierros, ½ docena D. paquetes D. llaves para desarmar llantas y otros materiales mas pequeños.

Virginia nos dijo que Manuela Ramos es lo máximo con los préstamos porque gracias a ellos su negocio surgió. Ella se siente feliz y su familia también y siempre dando gracias a nuestro Señor por todas las cosas brindadas.

loans.use: To buy hardware items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toys

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela is a woman of 33 years of age, and she lives in her own home with her husband and two children. Marcela is an assistant in the Incubation Factory "Avicola Warnes", and she also receives an income from the rental of two motorcycle-taxi services.

Her experience on the job at the factory is extensive, as is with her motocycle-taxi service. There is no competition at the Plant because Marcela has started her own business, but her motorcycle-taxi serice is in a market that is very competitive from the many people that run similar businesses. But on the other hand the demand that she sees is great, mostly because at her Plant the motocycle-taxi service is the most common method of transportation.

She will use the loan to pay off a previous line of credit and to pay off a loan she had acquired for renovations to her house.

Marcela had three loans in the past with Agrocapital, and they were all fully-paid without problems. And she currently has another loan from another institution.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Marcela es una señora de 33 años de edad, actualmente vive es su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Marcela es ayudante en la Planta de Incubación de la Avícola Warnes, paralelamente recibe como ingreso la renta que genera sus dos mototaxis.

Su experiencia de trabajo en la planta avícola es bastante extensa y así también con el negocio de renta de mototaxis. No existe competencia por el lado de la Planta Avicola ya que Marcela es dependiente de la misma, sin embargo en el negocio de renta de mototaxis la misma es bastante elevada por la gran cantidad de personas que se dedican a este negocio, pero por otra parte la demanda también es elevada ya que en Warnes el mototaxi es el principal medio de transporte.

El dinero del préstamo ella lo utilizará para pagar el saldo pendiente que tenía de su anterior crédito y también para cancelar un saldo que debe por la construcción que hizo en su vivienda.

Marcela tuvo tres créditos anteriores con Agrocapital, y los mismos fueron cancelados de manera excelente, actualmente tiene otro crédito más en otra institución financiera que también se encuentra vigente.

loans.use: Expansion of her home and repayment of a previous loan.

loans.name: Isolda Graciela

texts.es:
Isolda Graciela is 47 years old, a single mother and lives in the 3-80 district of Managua. She manages a small Internet Café and in this way she has been able to advance. The construction of her house has cost her a lot of money and she is the only source of financial support for her family. She now needs a loan to build a room, which is not in the best condition, so that she can make her daughter more comfortable and continue to improve her humble abode.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Isolda Graciela tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua. Trabaja como administradora de un pequeño Café Internet y es así como ha logrado salir adelante. La construcción de su casa le ha costado mucho ya que ella es el único sostén de su familia. En la actualidad necesita el crédito para la construcción de un cuarto, el cual no presta las mejores condiciones de habitación y poder brindarle comodidad a su hija, e ir mejorando su humilde vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia is the mother of 7 children, all of which have supported her more than her husband, which is the reason why they have made it through the hard times. Her business, which has now been running for 20 years, she began by selling her products among her neighbours to earn some money and provide her children with supplies, because her husband was not very responsible and spent his earnings on other things. Some time later Flavia saw that she needed to invest more time in the sales of her products because her husband suffered an embolism. Slowly but surely Flavia started to earn more clients and with their business she was able to offer more selection. Today Flavia sells seasonal clothing, perfumes and jewellery.

Flavia is requesting a loan of US$625 that she will repay in a term of 4 months. With these funds she will be able to purchase new lines of clothing and she will be able to fill the orders that have already been placed so that she will be able to offer something new for the holiday season. With your help Flavia will be able to succeed and she will be able to assist her husband recover from that terrible condition.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Flavia es madre de 7 hijos de los cuales ella considera que fue por su ayuda más que por la de su esposo que sus hijos salieron adelante. Puesto que desde hace 20 años, Flavia comenzó a vender productos entre sus vecinas para poder sacar un poco de dinero para poderles comprar útiles a sus hijos, puesto que su esposo se veía un poco irresponsable al gastarse sus quincenas en otras cosas. Tiempo después Flavia tuvo que dedicarse más tiempo a la venta de estos productos puesto que su esposo padeció de Embolia, así que Flavia tomó Poco a poco Flavia comenzó a hacerse de clientes y por lo tanto a ofrecerles más productos. Actualmente Flavia vende ropa de temporada, perfumes y joyería.

Sin embargo actualmente Flavia está solicitando un crédito de US $625 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, con este dinero poderá comprar productos nuevos como ropa y comprar la mercancía que le solicitaron para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecer en la temporada navideña. Con tu ayuda Flavio podrá salir adelante y sacar a su esposo delante de esta terrible enfermedad.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Jazmina

texts.es:
Jazmina lives in the Hialeah district of Managua where she owns a small grocery store that she runs herself. She is 40 years old and needs to buy more products for sales because at this time of year it is important to have variety of inventory so that she can offer more to her customers. This will be important in the future so that she and her family can get out of poverty and she can establish her business as a prosperous one with commercial stability.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Jazmina vive en el barrio Hialeah de Managua en donde tiene un pequeña pulpería administrada por ella misma. Tiene 40 años y requiere comprar más productos para su venta, ya que en esta época del año es cuando más necesidad de variedad de inventario necesita en su negocio, y así poder contar con una mejor oferta para sus clientes que en un futuro será clave para que ella y su familia puedan ir saliendo de la pobreza y establecerse como un negocio próspero y con estabilidad comercial.

loans.use: To purchase food products for her grocery store

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is 44 years old and currently lives in her own home with her three children who depend on her. Monthly she receives a check from La Vitalicia due to the death of her husband, and her son who is the co-debtor, is a mototaxi driver and supports the family with the income that he generates in this business. The public transportation business with mototaxis is quite competitive, but he accesses a high demand over it all in Warnes where he partners with the principal transportation group. With the loan presently requested Cristina will buy a line of taxis for her son, though she does not know yet which cooperative group they will affiliate themselves. This will be Cristina’s fourth loan with Agrocapital, during this time she has shown that she is responsible and serious person. She also has other loans with other financial institutions that she also is completing punctually

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Cristina tiene 44 años de edad, actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a sus tres hijos, que dependen de ella. Mensualmente recibe una renta de La Vitalicia por el fallecimiento de su esposo, y su hijo, que es codeudor de la presente solicitud, es mototaxista y apoya a la familia con el ingreso que le genera este negocio. El negocio de transporte público con mototaxis es bastante competitivo, pero así de elevada también es la demanda del mismo sobre todo en Warnes donde se consolida como el principal medio de transporte. Con el crédito de la presente solicitud Cristina comprará una línea de mototaxi para su hijo, aún no saben a que sindicato o cooperativa se afiliarán. Esta vendría a ser el cuarto préstamo de Cristina con agrocapital, durante este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y sería. También tiene otros créditos con otras intituciones financieras que también están siendo cancelado puntualmente.

loans.use: Buy a line of mototaxis

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel is 51 years old, single and has three children. For 29 years he has been providing taxi services, work with which he has been able to progress little by little. His works generates the income to support his family and to improve his home. With this loan he will replace the roof over his house, which is not in good condition, so that his home can get through the winter without being flooded.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Fidel tiene 51 años, es soltero y tiene tres hijos. Tiene 29 años de brindar servicios de taxi, lo cual le ha permitido ir creciendo poco a poco, su trabajo le genera los ingresos para poder sostener a su familia e ir mejorando su vivienda. Con el dinero cambiará el techo de su casa que no se encuentra en muy buen estado, para poder recibir el invierno sin que su casa se le llene de agua.

loans.use: To replace the roof over one of the rooms in his home.

loans.name: Alcira Felina

texts.es:
Mrs. Alcira Felina is 28 years of age, a high school graduate, and mother of 3 dependent children. She lives in the “Asentamiento Human Nuevo Jerusalén” in the La Esperanza district of the Trujillo Province, La Libertad department. She started her own business by creating a small convenient store in her home, where she sells rice, sugar, and cooking oil, among other products. Thanks to the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from her group Mientras Tanto “Jerusalén” she has been able to stock her shop with other merchandise. For example, she is now selling school supplies. With this loan of 500.00 soles, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase retail cases so that she can display her products. Her biggest wish is to have a bigger and better stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Alcira Felina tiene 28 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa y tiene 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el Asentamiento Humano Nuevo Jerusalén, distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Hace 2 años inició un negocio colocando en su casa una pequeña tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros. Gracias al primer préstamo de S/.300.00 que recibió en su Grupo Mientras Tanto “Jerusalén” ha podido surtir su bodega con otros artículos, por ejemplo ahora también está vendiendo útiles escolares. Con este préstamo de S/.500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará vitrinas para exhibir sus productos. Su mayor anhelo es tener una tienda mucho mas grande y bien surtida.

loans.use: Purchase of retail display case

loans.name: Miguel Crispin

texts.es:
Miguel is 47 years old and he lives in his house with his two children. This house is located in the Antonio SAAD St., North of Warnes. His wife doesn’t live with them because she is working abroad.

He works as an equipment operator in the dairy plant PIL Andina and supplements his income by renting out part of his house.

His job is reliable, so there is not much risk of being unemployed and his rental income it’s also reliable due to a continuous renting demand in the area.

With this loan the client will purchase all the material he needs to build the bathroom he needs for his house. This would give him an inside bathroom for his family and the current outside bathroom would be used by his renters.

This would be the third loan for Miguel with Agrocapital, he had an excellent repayment history on his previous two loans, and he currently has two loans with other financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel tiene 47 años de edad y vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la calle Antonio SAAD zona norte de Warnes, su esposa no vive con ellos ya que se encuentra trabajando en el exterior.

Miguel trabaja como operador de equipo II en la planta de leche PIL Andina y paralelamente recibe ingresos por concepto de alquiler de parte de su casa.

En cuanto al trabajo como operario es trabajador dependiente y no existe mucho riesgo, por otra parte en cuanto al alquiler de su casa tampoco ya que la demanda de alquileres es continua.

Con la presente solicitud el cliente construirá y comprará todos los equipos de baño que necesita para su casa, mismo que será trasladado ya que actualmente se encuentra fuera de la misma, y el baño de afuera será para uso de sus inquilinos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Miguel en Agrocapital, los cuales pagó excelentemente, también tiene dos créditos en otras financieras que también los mantiene vigentes.

loans.use: Building a bathroom for his house

loans.name: Vailili

texts.en: Vailili is a 60-year-old widow with four children. She grows crops on her plantation and sells them in the local market two days a week, where she earns about $72 per day. She supplements her income by working in a nearby vegetable garden. Vailili has applied for a new loan to buy chemicals and tools she needs to maintain and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Filomena Rosario De

texts.es:
Filomena is 54 years of age. Her husband is a landlord who has retired from the SOBOLMA Company and receives a monthly pension. He is currently working for this company, but no longer receives any social benefits from it. Filomena, her husband, and two children live in their own home. This family depends solely on the income from the father’s retirement fund. They pose no financial risk since they are under the protection of a private company. Filomena will use the loan for the purchase of lumber ($480.00 USD) and she will buy roofing shingles for her home expansion with the remainder of the money. This is her fourth loan with our institution, which she has paid punctually. She currently has no other debts in the financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Filomena es una señora de 54 años de edad, su esposo es rentista y recibe mensualmente ingreso por su jubilación en la empresa SOBOLMA, donde actualmente sigue trabajando pero sin derecho a beneficios sociales. Filomena, su esposo y sus dos hijos viven en su casa que es propia. Esta familia sólo cuenta con el ingreso de jubilación que percibe el padre de familia. No comtemplan ningún riesgo al ser dependientes de una empresa privada. Filomena con el crédito comprará madera por un valor de $us. 480.- y lo restante utilizará en la compra de tejas para la ampliación de la vivienda. Este es el cuarto préstamo con nuestra institución, mismo que pagó de manera puntual, actualmente no tiene otras deudas en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Construction of one bedroom

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en: Ulato is a 67-year-old woman with three children. Her plantation is her family's only means of support, and she has been running it for a long time. She sells her crops at the market while her sons do manual labour in the fields. She goes to the market with her produce three times a week and makes a profit of $124 a per day. She appreciates the help she has received from previous loans, and hopes to use her new loan to increase the output of her plantation.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is a hard-working mother with six children who opened a grocery store several years ago to help support her family.  Her children also contribute to the family's income by working when and wherever they can.  Epenesa is applying for a new loan to expand her business, which brings in about $112 a day. She hopes to use the extra income made possible by the loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: To restock her grocery store

loans.name: Setupuaseve

texts.en: Setupuaseve is 22 years old and joined SPBD last year to get funding to start two businesses, a shop and a plantation. She has done very well in both areas, and has now applied for a new loan to restock her general store and rebuild her house. She makes $72 a day from the shop and about $96 a day  from the plantation.

loans.use: To restock her grocery store and for home improvements

loans.name: Itaifafo

texts.en: Itaifafo is 39 years old, married and has five children. She is an excellent fisherwoman who heads out to sea three days a week -- every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday.  She earns $48 a day from this business, thanks to her own hard work and help from her husband. She and her husband also run a plantation, where they earn an additional $72 a week for themselves and their family.  Itaifafo has applied for a new loan which she will use to buy more fishing gear and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy fishing gear and for home improvements

loans.name: Bertha Ema

texts.es:
Bertha is a 32-year-old teacher in the community of Clara Cuchio. Concurrently, she also sells cosmetics, clothes, and accessories. She has an 8-year-old daughter. Bertha has been working both jobs for a long time, thus she has plenty of experience. She has moderate competition because there are other people in her area who work in the same field as she does. She will use this loan as capital to purchase more merchandise, since the year-end festivities allow for a greater demand of apparel and accessories. Prices vary depending on consumer demand and the quality of the product. Bertha’s credit history is excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha tiene 32 años de edad y es maestra en la comunidad de Clara Cuchio, paralelamente también se dedica al comercio de cosméticos, ropas y otros. Su familia está compuesta por dos personas ella y su hija de 8 años de edad. Bertha trabaja desde hace bastante tiempo en ambas actividades por lo que su experiencia es extensa. La competitividad en ambos negocios es medio debido a que existen otras personas que trabajan en estos rubros. El presente préstamo será destinado como capital de trabajo, Bertha adquirirá mercadería dado que por las fiestas de fin de año existe bastante demanda de diversos artículos y prendas de vestir, los precios de los mismos varían dependiendo a la demanda y calidad. Los antecedentes crediticios de Bertha son excelentes.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Neida Martina

texts.es:
Neida is 34 years old, and she lives with her husband and their five children in their own home located in the community of Asuzaqui (10 km northeast of Warnes). Neida dedicates herself to baking and selling homemade bread, while her husband is in charge of raising hogs in the C&M Co-op. For the last four years, the bakery has been located in Neida’s own home, and husband has also worked for some time at the C&M. The bakery faces a low level of competition due in part to the number of people working in the field, but also because Neida is known to offer a high-quality product. The credit will be used to purchase 3 units of flour at $24 each, 3 units of sugar at $25 each, and 3 cans of butter at $20 each, and she will also acquire raw ingredients needed to make her bread as well as other products. Neida had three credits with our institution that she paid off promptly, and she currently has no other debts in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Neida de 34 años de edad, es una señora casada que vive en su casa propia que se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de asuzaqui a nos 10 Km. al noreste de Warnes, junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos. Neida se dedica a la elaboración y comercio de pan casero de manera rudimentaria, por otra parte su esposo trabaja como encargado de la maternidad de chanchos en la Agropecuaria C y M. La panadería se encuentra instalada en el mismo domicilio de Neida desde hace cuatro años atrás, y su esposo también trabaja hace bastante tiempo en la Agropecuaria C y M. En el caso de la panadería la competencia no es muy elevada debido a la cantidad de personas que trabajan en este rubro, por otra parte Neida se identifica al ofrecer un producto de excelente calidad. El crédito será para comprar 3 qq de harina a $us. 23.41 cada uno, también comprará 3 qq de azúcar a $us. 24.71 cada uno y 3 latas de manteca a $us. 19.51 cada uno, también adquirirá materia prima para la elaboración de pan y material de construcción para otros fines. Neida tuvo tres créditos con nuestra institución los cuales cancelo puntualmente, actualmente no tiene otras deudas en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Invest in ingredients for the bakery, including flour, sugar, and butter

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby is 32 years old and lives with her family that is composed of seven people, her husband, her parents, and her four kids. She is dedicated to the traveling sales of clothing items through the different fairs and markets of Warnes. Her husband works as driver for the poultry company INACRUZ. Gaby has been dedicated to selling clothes for six years which has given her a very elevated competence level, and she works with a group of customers that she has known for several years. With the requested loan she will buy merchandise of kids clothes since she already has a great demand from this age group; the prices will vary of the different models and quality of the items. The previous loans with Gaby were excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Gaby de 32 años de edad, vive con su familia que está compuesta por siete personas, su esposo, sus padres y cuatro hijos. Se dedica al comercio de prendas de vestir ambulando por las diferentes ferias y mercados de Warnes, su esposo trabaja como chofer en la avícola INACRUZ. Gaby se dedica a la comercialización de ropa desde hace seis años, por lo que su competencia no es muy elevada, pese a la catidad de personas que trabajan en este rubro, esto debido a que cuenta con clientela que la conoce desde hace varios años. Con la presente solicitud comprará mercadería, es decir ropa de niños ya que tienen mejor demanda en esta época del año, los precios de los mismos variaran de los modelos y calidad de las prendas. Los antecedentes de Gaby son excelentes.

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Yianina Saori

texts.es:
Señora Yanina Saori lives int he district of El Porvenir, in the town of Trujillo in the state of La Libertad. She is 27 years old and she has 3 children whom she supports. She finished some college courses, but couldn't get a degree due to personal problems.

She joined the local community bank "Victor Raul" at the request of her aunt. She obtained her first loan through this bank in the amount of $300 Nuevo Soles. With this money, she travelled to Lima to buy more clothes so that she could meet her clients' demands because at that time Señora Yanina only sold clothes. Currently, she has added beauty products to the list of items she sells from door to door. For the most part she sells to people she knows but she also travels to the district of Salpo where she used to live.

With this loan of $475 USD, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase toys to sell them during the holiday season.

Señora Yanina dreams of owning a restaurant selling Creole food.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yanina Saori vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 27 años, con 3 hijos que aún depende de ella, tiene grado de instrucción superior incompleta (no pudo terminar de estudiar por problemas personales). Ingresó al Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl” por invitación de una tía. En este banco comunal obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/.300.00. Con este dinero viajó a Lima para comprar ropa y así atender sus pedidos, pues la señora Yanina en ese entonces se dedicaba sólo a la venta de ropa. Actualmente también vende productos de belleza, los cuales los distribuye casa por casa a personas conocidas y también vende en la sierra de la región, específicamente en el distrito de Salpo, lugar donde ella vivió anteriormente. Con este préstamo de S/.1,400.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará juguetes para venderlos en esta campaña navideña. La señora Yanina sueña con tener un restaurante de comida criolla.

loans.use: To purchase toys

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in basic ingredients for her kitchen and for the other items her clients want

loans.name: Eliana Caridad

texts.es:
Señora Eliana Caridad T. R. is 30 years old. She finished high school. She has 2 children whom she supports. They live in the district of El Porvenir, in the town of T. in the state of La Libertad.

Señora Eliana has worked since she was 8 years old helping her mother sell fruits and vegetables. This is why she knows a lot about this business because she also sells fruits and vegetables at the local market in the city of T..

She is a founding member of the local community bank called "Victor Raul". She insisted in forming a bank because she's very knowledgeable in the general functions of a community bank since her mother is also a member of a community bank. She obtained her first loan through this bank which was in the amount of $300 Nuevo Soles. She used this money to fix up the space/stand which she leases at the local market.

With this loan of $450 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale price so that she can hopefully make a good profit.

Señora Eliana dreams of owning her own locale at one of the bigger markets in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eliana Caridad T. R. tiene 30 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa y tiene 2 hijos a los cuales todavía mantiene. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de T., departamento de La Libertad. La señora Eliana trabajaba ayudando a su mamá desde que tenía 8 años, por eso es que conoce del negocio. Tiene un puesto de verduras y frutas en un pequeño mercado en la ciudad de T.. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl”. Ella fue las más empeñosa en formarlo porque también tenía conocimiento del funcionamiento de los bancos comunales, debido a que su mamá es socia de un banco de la sierra de La Libertad. En este banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 con lo cual terminó de acondicionar su puesto que no estaba en buen estado cuando lo alquiló. Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará verduras y frutas al por mayor para obtener mayores utilidades. La señora Eliana sueña con tener un puesto propio en uno de los mercados grandes de la ciudad.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Elisa Efigenia

texts.es:
Señora Elisa Efigenia is 60 years old. She finished elementary school. She currently lives in the district of El Porvenir, in the town of Trujillo in the state of La Libertad.

She used to live in the district of Salpo, in the town of Otuzco, but she decided to move to the town of Trujillo because all of her children lived there.

Since she has always been able to take care of herself financially, she decided to lease a small space, located close to a public transportation company, where she sells spare car parts and car accessories. She tells us that she started with only selling car accessories, but thanks to the loans she's been able to obtained from her local community bank, she has been able to expand her business by adding spare car parts.

Señora Elisa is a member of the local community bank called "Victor Raul" where she obtained her first loan in the amount of $300 nuevo sol. With this money, she was able to purchase spare car parts.

With this loan of $175, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase oils, bolts, schock absorbers, etc. Her dream is to one day have her own locale where she can sell her car parts.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elisa Efigenia tiene 60 años D. edad, estudió primaria completa. Actualmente vive en el distrito D. El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad. Anteriormente la señora Elisa vivía en el Distrito D. Salpo, provincia D. Otuzco, en la Sierra D. la región, pero decidió venir a vivir a Trujillo porque todos sus hijos ya están radicando en esta ciudad. Como estaba acostumbrada a trabajar y tener sus ingresos propios consigue un local pequeño para vender repuestos y accesorios para carros en un lugar cercano a una empresa D. transporte público. Nos manifiesta que empezó vendiendo sólo accesorios pero gracias a los préstamos recibidos en su banco comunal ha podido ampliar su negocio a la venta D. repuestos. La señora Elisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl” en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00, dinero que utilizó para comprar repuestos e iniciar la venta D. los mismos. Con este préstamo D. S/.500, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará grasas, pernos, amortiguadores, empaquetaduras, entre otros. Su mayor sueño es tener un local propio en donD. vender sus repuestos.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts and accessories (oils, bolts schock absorbers, etc)

loans.name: Flor Del Lago Panajachel Group

texts.es:
The ladies of the coop bank «Flor del Lago Panajachel» have unparalleled hopes that their businesses will succeed. These hopes will be able to materialize thank to their first loan that they will receive on behalf of the Kiva investors.

The new future clients are very extroverted and witty. This must be because they live in Panajachel, a town that has high turism, and they are exposed to all types of people from many different cultures.

This group of women are very hard workers. They alll work in different businesses. Maria Ajun mines Piedrin (a material that is used in building houses) on the shores of the Panajachel River, others knit items of traditional clothing, and there is a smaller group among these that work as jewellers working with mostacilla beads. Maria Zenaida resells CDs, DVDs and MP3s. And finally, Telma R. has a mobile cosmetics business.

The will use their share of the loan for different things. Some will want to purchase fabrics to make pants. Other will want to purchase yarn for embroidering traditional clothing, and table cloths among other things. Maria will want to use her share of the loan to purchase more piedrin material in the river so that she will be able to sell more in return.

Eventhough the market is in their favor, many clients have faced different obstacles in life such as not have had the privilege of an education, competence, and lack of capital funds. Nonetheless, thanks to this loan and the education that the FriendshipBride has provided these women, they will be able to branch out on their own.

Anselma M.' dream is to pruchase large quantities of materials to produce beaded jewellery at the lowest possible cost and this way corner the local market. Isabel S. comented that she would like to expand her food production business and start a restaurant. Nelly V. dreams of purchasing a small piece of land.

These women have high hopes and wonderful dreams, if they are given the support that they need they will be able to realize their dreams. This support can come from you. Take this opportunity to make a difference in the world.

One of the clients is missing from the photo. She was absent due to medical reasons.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres del banco comunal Flor del Lago Panajachel tienen unas esperanzas inigualables de que su negocio salga adelante. Estas esperanza se van a poder concretar gracias al primer préstamo que van a recibir de parte de los inversores que participan en Kiva.

Nuestras futuras clientas son muy extrovertidas y pícaras. Esto se debe a que ellas viven en Panajachel, un lugar muy turístico, y están expuestas a todo tipo de personas que provienen de distintas culturas.

Este grupo de señoras son realmente trabajadoras. Las señoras trabajan en distintos negocios. María Ajun trabaja excavando piedrín (un material que se utiliza para la construcción de casas) a las orillas del río Panajachel, otras tejen ropa típica, también hay un grupo que trabajan con joyas, las cuales elaboran con mostacilla. María Zenaida trabaja en la reventa de CDs, DVDs y MP3. Finalmente, Telma R. tiene una venta ambulante de cosméticos.

Estas señoras van a utilizar su préstamo para distintas cosas. Algunas quieren comprar más telas para hacer pantalones. Otras quieren comprar más hilos para trabajar el bordado de huipiles, manteles y fajas tradicionales. Doña María quiere utilizar su préstamo para comprar más piedrín en el río de los otros trabajadores, para que cuando venga el camión ella le pueda vender más piedrín.

A pesar de que el mercado las favorece, muchas clientas han encontrado diferentes obstáculos en la vida tales como falta de educación, competencia y la falta de capital. Sin embargo, ahora gracias al crédito y la educación que Friendship Bridge les da a las mujeres, ellas van a ser capaces de destacar.

El sueño de Anselma M. es de comprar grandes cantidades de materia prima para ser capaz de producir joyería de mostacilla al menor costo posible y de esa manera destacar en el mercado local. Isabel S., comentó que ella quería ampliar su negocio de ventas de almuerzo y poner un restaurante. Nelly Velásquez sueña con comprarse un terrenito.

Estas señoras tienen una esperanza y sueños muy grandes, si se les da el apoyo necesario ellas van a ser capaces de realizar sus sueños. Ese apoyo puede venir de ustedes. Aprovechen esta oportunidad para marcar la diferencia en el mundo.

Una de las clientas falta en la foto por razones médicas

loans.use: Purchase of materials for the production of traditional outfits and jewellery; Purchase of clothing; Purchase of DVDs; Purchase of Piedrin for sale and construction.

loans.name: Maritza Elia

texts.es:
Señora Maritza is 42 years old. She finished high school. She has 3 children who still depend on her financially. They live in the district of El Porvenir, in the town of Trujillo in the state of La Libertad.

She works in the craft industry making sandals which she sells at wholesale price to the various different local markets in her city. She has also asked her sister to sell sandals for her in other cities.

Señora Maritza is a member of the local community bank called 'Creative Little Seeds' which she joined at a request from one of her sisters. She obtained her first loan of $300 Nuevo Sol which she purchased leather and synthetic material to make sandals.

With this loan of $175 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase material such as leather, moulds, soles and much more.

Señora Maritza is not only happy at making sandals, but she would also like to one day open up a bookstore out of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maritza Elia tiene 42 años, estudió la secundaria y tiene 3 niños que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a la fabricación artesanal de sandalias, las cuales vende al por mayor en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, además también le da a su hermana para que los distribuya en otras ciudades. La señora Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal “Semillitas Creativas” al cual ingresó por invitación de una de sus hermanas y obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300, con lo cual compró cuero y material sintético para la confección de las sandalias. Con este préstamo de S/.500.00 soles, el cual se pagará en cuatro meses, comparará material como cuero, hormas, plantas, entre otros. La señora Maritza no solo se contenta con la fabricación de sandalias, sino que sueña con poner una librería en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase leather, moulds and shoe soles

loans.name: Yanet De

texts.es:
Yanet is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in her mother's house. She works as a secretary in the María Magdalena Postel school and also sells cosmetics, perfumes, and other items. She has quite a bit of experience in both of these occupations due to the time that she devotes to them. Her excellent attention to her clientele makes them loyal and consistent, which minimizes the risk of competition, of which there is a lot. Yanet needs this credit to supply her merchandise for the end of the year. Her credit record is good, and she doesn't have any current debts with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yanet es una señora de 34 años de edad, actualmente vive con su esposo y su hija en la casa de su madre. Ella trabaja como secretaria en el colegio Maria Magdalena Postel y paralelamente también vende cosméticos, perfumes y otros. Yanet tiene bastante experiencia en ambos rubros debido al tiempo al que le dedica a ambas actividades, su excelente atención a su clientela hace que los mismos sean leales y consecuentes, esto minimiza el riesgo de la competencia que es elevada. Yanet necesita el presente crédito para surtir su mercadería para fin de año. Sus antecedentes crediticios son buenos, actualmente no tiene deudas con otras instituciones financieras.

loans.use: Purchase of capital

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Señora Teodolinda is 45 years old. She finished elementary school. She has 3 children and one of them still depends on her financially. She lives in the district of El Porvenir, in the town of Trujillo in the state of La Libertad.

In the past, Señora Teodolinda used to sell used clothes from door to door and from town to town. During one of her trips, she was robbed. They took all of her merchandise and all of her money. Due to this bad experience, she had to start all over again. She decided to open up some sort of business where she didn't have to travel. She was invited by one of her friends to join the local bank called "Blessing from God" where she obtained her first loan of $300 Nuevo Sol. She bought fruits, vegetables and herbs, and she began selling them at the local market close to her house.

With this loan of $525 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase chickens, dry fish and some 'panetones' (which is a type of fruit bread and sold in Peru during the holiday season). Her dream is to have her own pick-up truck.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teodolinda tiene 45 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos y una todavía depende de ella. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Anteriormente la señora Teodolinda se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada, la cual llevaba a vender a diferentes pueblos de la sierra de la región, pero en uno de esos viajes le robaron todos sus productos y dinero en efectivo. Debido a esta situación tuvo que empezar de nuevo, pero decidió poner un negocio que pueda realizarlo sin necesidad de viajar porque es muy riesgoso. En ese momento es invitada por una amiga a participar del Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” en el cual obtiene su primer préstamo de S/.300.00, con lo cual empieza a vender verduras, frutas y hierbas en un pequeño mercado cerca de su domicilio. Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará pollos, pescado seco y también comprará unos cuantos panetones para vender en la campaña navideña. Su mayor sueño es tener su propia camioneta.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, dry fish and 'panetones'

loans.name: Gladys Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Gladys Fredesvinda lives in Urbanización Libertad in the city of Trujillo, in the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad. She is 50-years-old, she finished high school, and she has 3 children who still depend on her. Since her husband rents a car to offer taxi services and his income is minimal, she saw the need to work to help with the family expenses. This is why she started a business selling beer with money her sister lent her. Later, through the invitation of a neighbor, she joined the interim group, Cielo (Sky), where she received her first loan of 300 nuevos soles. With this money, she bought 5 boxes of beer to increase her sales. She saved her resources and little by little purchased baby clothing to sell on credit to people she knew.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy clothing for babies and children because she already has several orders for the holidays. Gladys dreams about having a store in a large mall in the city and also in seeing her daughters become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Gladys Fredesvinda vive en la Urbanización Libertad D. la ciudad D. Trujillo, Provincia D. Trujillo, Departamento D. La Libertad. Tiene 50 años D. edad , estudió secundaria completa y tiene 3 hijos que aun dependen D. ella. Debido a que su esposo alquila un auto para brindar servicio D. taxi y su ingreso es mínimo se vio en la obligación D. trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. D. esa manera inicia un negocio vendiendo cerveza con un dinero que le prestó su hermana. Posteriormente, por invitación D. una vecina, ingresa al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Cielo” donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00, con este dinero compró 5 cajas D. cerveza para incrementar las ventas. Fue ahorrando sus utilidades y poco a poco iba comprando ropa D. bebé para vender al crédito a algunas personas conocidas . Con este préstamo D. S/.500.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará ropa para bebés y niños porque tiene varios pedidos para estas fiestas D. fin D. año.

La señora Gladys sueña con tener una tienda en un centro comercial granD. D. la ciudad y también con ver a sus hijas profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for babies and children

loans.name: Oae

texts.en: Creativity and artistic talent have allowed Oae S. to establish a successful elei (a traditional Samoan fabric) printing company, and her business skills have allowed her to establish a second company that sells chips and ice cakes (or popsickles). Age is not a problem for this 61-year-old mother, whose dedication and energy keep her very happy selling products to people not just in her town, but in nearby towns as well.  She earns about $60 a week, and is very grateful for the financial assistance extended to her in pervious loans. She plans to use this new loan to buy more supplies for her printing and food businesses.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her elei printing business and her food stall

loans.name: Maletina

texts.en: In Samoa, people of all ages love pancakes, and they eat them not just for breakfast, but at any time of the day. This is the reason why Maletina decided to open a pancake stall. She knew that she could earn money making pancakes to sell not just at the village school, but also in many other places. Malteina makes about $24 a day, but hopes that the loan she is applying for will allow her to expand her business and generate the income she needs to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her pancake business and for home improvement

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge is twenty years old, single and lives in a house with his mother in the Juan Pablo II development. Presently he works doing contract masonry, plumbing and other construction work.

Jorge has enough experience doing this work because he starting working in the field when he was 15 years old.

Thanks to his find handiwork and his high level of responsibility, he doesn’t lack work, which minimizes the risk of competition.

With this loan Jorge will purchase tools for his work and will also use it to do some other jobs because he will make more money faster. Right now he only has loans with Agrocapital and one other financier, which he pays back responsibly and on time.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Jorge tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la casa de su madre en la Urbanización Juan Pablo II, actualmente se dedica a prestar servicios como albañil contratista, plomero y otros servicios de la construcción.

Jorge tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro debido a que empezó a trabajar en el mismo desde sus 15 años.

Debido a la mano de obra fina y a la responsabilidad que tiene, no le falta trabajo, lo que minimiza el riesgo de la competencia.

Jorge con la presente solicitud se comprará algunas herramientas para su trabajo y también utilizará el dinero para hacer algunos trabajos como obra vendida ya que ganaría mejor y más rápido. Actualmente sólo tiene crédito con Agrocapital y otra financiera, mismos que paga de manera puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Work capital and repaying a previous loan

loans.name: Faalogoae

texts.en: Faalogoae is 48 years old and lives in the village of Vailele. She joined SPBD a year ago, shortly before receiving her first loan, and has now applied for a second loan  to expand her barbecue business. She's done well in this line of work because her family owns a plantation where she gets most of the produce that she sells to her customers. Faalogoae will use her loan to keep her stand open every Wednesday and Saturday, the days when demand is strongest and sales are highest.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her barbecue business and for home improvements

loans.name: Komi

texts.en: Komi is a 60-year-old widow with six children, all of whom are married with children of their own.  Although she is a grandmother many times over, Komi is still going strong, running a stand where she sells popcorn and ice cakes (or popsickles in plastic bags). She sell these items to the people of her village, including members of her church. Komi earns the equivalent of $68 every week, and has applied for a new loan which she plans to use for home improvements and to expand her business

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her snack stand and for home improvements

loans.name: Celina Esperanza

texts.es:
Señora Celina Esperanza finished high school. She is 51 years old and she has 2 sons who still depend on her financially. They live in the Carabamba district, which is a province in Julcan in the state of La Libertad.

Señora Celina Esperanza started selling food out of her home every Sunday which is a day full of festivities since all the locals from all districts come down to the main plaza to do the weekly shopping and to sell various products. She has been selling food over the past 15 years.

She is the founding member of the community bank called "Alfa and Omega" which was the bank where she received her first loan of $300 Nuevo Sol. She was able to opened up a small convenience store which she still owns, and has been growing ever since. Aside from the convenience store and selling food, Señora Celina also raises and sells small animals such as chickens, calves and guinea pigs.

With this loan of $675 usd, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy 6 calves, some chickens and some guinea pigs. She also wants to buy more merchandise for her store. She would also like to purchase a stove, which she really needs, since she cooks on a wood-burning grill.

She is the treasurer of a club called "Miracle Medal" which is composed of the local moms in town. Her dream is to one day open up a big restaurant in Carabamba.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Celina Esperanza estudió secundaria completa, tiene 51 años de edad y 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán, departamento de La Libetad. La señora Celina empezó vendiendo comida en su casa los días domingos, que es día de feria en el pueblo y baja gente de todos los caseríos del distrito para realizar sus compras semanales y venta de algunos productos, hace quince años que se dedica a este negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Alfa y Omega”, en este banco comunal recibió su primer préstamo de S/.300.00, con este dinero pudo empezar a implementar su bodeguita que tiene hasta la actualidad y que ha ido creciendo poco a poco. A parte de la bodega y la venta de comida, la señora Celina se dedica también a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y carneros. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará 6 carneros, unas cuantas gallinas y cuyes, también comparará abarrotes para la tienda y una cocina que le hacia falta ya que antes cocinaba con leña. Es tesorera del club de madres “Medalla Milagrosa”, su mayor sueño es tener un local propio para poner un gran restaurante en Carabamba.

loans.use: To purchase 6 calves, some chickens and guinea pigs.  To purchase more store merchandise and a stove

loans.name: Betania 4 Group

texts.es:
María is 40-years-old, she has 4 children, and her husband is a peasant. She does artesanship by weaving bracelets, necklaces, and belts, which she goes to sell in the city of San Cristobal in the Santo Domingo Artesans' Market. All of the other members of her group also make silk bracelets and belts and sell them to people who come to their homes to purchase them to resell in the tourist zones in Chiapas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

MARIA TIENE 40 AÑOS , CUATRO HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD ARTESANAL TEJE E HILA PULSERAS , COLLARES Y CINTURONES LOS CUALES BAJA A VENDER A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL EN EL MERCADO DE LAS ARTESANIAS DE SANTO DOMINGO. TODAS LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO TAMBIEN SE DEDICAN A CONFECCIONAR PULSERAS Y CINTURONES EN HILOS DE SEDA Y LAS VENDEN A PERSONAS QUE LLEGAN A SUS CASAS A COMPRAR PARA REVENDER EN LAS ZONAS TURISTICAS DE CHIAPAS.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of yarns to embroider and fabric to make their garments

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago is 37 years old and lives with his wife and kids. Santiago offers gardening services and his wife dedicates her self to selling groceries and also works at a call center. The family has quite a lot of experience in all these businesses due to the fact they have always been working in these same businesses. Their diverse services are offered with quality and good customer treatment and has resulted in high demand and returning customers. The loan will be used to offer more merchandise in the grocery shop since parties for the end of the year will increase demand. Right now, Santiago is only requesting a loan from Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Santiago de 37 años de edad, vive con su esopa e hijos. Santiago ofrece servicios de jardineria y su esposa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y también atiende su punto de llamadas. La familia tiene bastante experiencia en todos sus negocios, debido a que siempre se dedicaron a los mismos. La competencia es elevada pero debido al tiempo que ofrecen sus diversos servicios además de la calidad de trato a la clientela cuentan con buena demanda y clientes fijos. El crédito utilizarán para proveer de más mercadería la tienda de abarrotes ya que por las fiestas de fin de año la demanda incrementá. Actualmente Santiago sólo tiene crédito con Agrocapital.

loans.use: Capital for his grocery shop

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Señora María dreams of living in the town of Trujillo, and setting-up her business there because she believes that this town offers the best economic prospects. Maria Cristina has 5 children, but only one is dependent on her. Maria didn’t attend school because her parents didn’t consider it important. She lives in the district of Caramba, in Julcan province in the department of La Libertad. Aged 53, she is a hard-working woman and runs several businesses: she has a store in which she sells groceries and some vegetables, and she also buys and sells cheese. Often, Maria prepares cachanga (corn bread), baked potatoes and picaroons (sweet pumpkin dough balls) to sell these on every street corner in her neighbourhood. She also buys animals and takes them to sell in the town if Trujillo in the wholesale market.

Maria began her business with the first loan she received from the community bank “Alpha and Omega”, who gave her a total of 300 Soles, with which she bought stock for her grocery store.

With the loan of 1,100 Soles, which she will repay within 4 months, she will buy a sack of rice, one of sugar, oil and food for her animals.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora María sueña con vivir en la ciudad de Trujillo y poner ahí su negocio porque considera que en esta ciudad existe mayor movimiento económico. La señora Maria Cristina tiene 5 hijos pero solo 1 depende de ella, no asistió a la escuela porque sus padres no lo consideraron importante. Vive en el distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán, departamento de La Libertad. A sus 53 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y se dedica a muchos negocios, tiene una bodega en la que vende abarrotes y un poco de verduras así mismo compra y vende quesillo. Muchas veces la señora Maria prepara cachangas, papa rellena, picarones, entre otros, para venderlos en cualquier esquina de su zona y además compra animales y los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Trujillo en el mercado Mayorista.

La señora Maria empieza su negocio con el primer préstamo que recibió en el Banco Comunal “Alfa y Omega” por un monto de S/.300.00, con lo cual compró abarrotes para implementar su bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,100.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses comprará un saco de arroz , uno de azúcar, aceite y alimento para sus animales.

loans.use: Buy a sack of rice, one of sugar, oil and food for her animals

loans.name: Falelua

texts.en: Falelua is a 67 year old mother. She is married with eight children. She is still very active and helps out with her family’s fishing and plantation business. Falelua is one of the oldest members of SPBD and she is also a center chief of the Safaatoa Tai village borrowing center.  This will be her fifth loan. She will use it to purchase supplies for her plantation and to improve her home. She makes $350 WST ($140 USD) per week, which she uses to meet family needs like church donations, bils, and food. She will also use the income to repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation and for home improvement

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Fourty-two years old Natividad lives in her own house with her husband and children. She has a small store, located at home, where she offers food and beverages. She also receives income from the rent of properties. Her husband offers his services as construction worker. Both Natividad and her husband have accumulated great experience in their respective fields. Additionally, competition is low, the demand for their services is constant and they have regular clients.

The requested loan will be used to expand her business and to buy a freezer and other needed articles. Her credit history is good and she presently has no loans from other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad, de 42 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos, y se dedica a la atención de su local, ubicado en su domicilio, donde ofrece comidas y bebidas. También percibe ingresos por concepto de alquileres. Por otra parte su esposo ofrece sus servicios como albañil. Tanto Natividad como su esposo tienen bastante experiencia en los rubros que se desempeñan. Por otro lado, la competencia no es elevada, ya que la demanda de sus servicios es constante y además cuentan con clientes fijos.

La presente solicitud es para la ampliación de su negocio y para la compra de freezer y otros artículos necesarios. Su antecedente crediticio es bueno y actualmente no tiene créditos en otras instituciones.

loans.use: Business expansion and purchase of products.

loans.name: Leala

texts.en: Leala is 46 years of age and married with 3 children. She is from the village of Tulaele. Leala is the center chief for the Tulaele borrowing center. She runs her bingo business twice a week on Wednesdays and Saturdays. She also sells snacks such as ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) and popcorn. She earns around $300 WST ($120 USD) per week. The income goes toward paying bills, church donations, and groceries among other needs. She has never forgotten a loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her snacks business

loans.name: Granadilla 5 Group

texts.es:
Yazmin is 21-years-old and has one son. Her husband works in the offices of Petroleos mexicanos (PEMEX). She makes crafts out of flexible rubber and felt for decorating the home, keepsakes, holidays, and birthdays. She sells them among her neighbors, family members, and friends. Two of the other members of the group make crafts like bracelets and belts out of silk thread. Erendida orders shoes from catalogs and sells them women in their community.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

YAZMIN TIENE 21 AÑOS , UN HIJO SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADO PARTICULAR EN LAS OFICNAS DE PETROLEOS MEXICANOS ( PEMEX ), ELLA SE DEDICA REALIZANDO Y CONFECCIONANDO MANUALIDADES EN MATERIALES DE GOMA FLEXIBLE Y GENERO ( FIELTRO) PARA DECORACION DEL HOGAR , RECUERDOS , FIESTAS Y CUMPLEAÑOS . LAS VENDE ENTRE SUS VECINAS, FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS . LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SE DESEMPEÑAN DOS DE ELLAS REALIZANDO ARTESANIAS TALES COMO PULSERAS Y CINTURONES EN HILOS DE SEDA EN CAMBIO ERENDIDA SE DEDICA A VENDER ZAPATOS A PEDIDOS POR CATALOGO ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SUS COMUNIDAD .

loans.use: They will invest in purchasing matierials to supply their businesses and to increase the production of their crafts

loans.name: Irma Lucia

texts.es:
Señora Irma Lucía is 34 years old, she completed primary school and has a son who is still dependent on her. She lives in the district of Carabamba, province of Julcan, department of La Libertad.

Currently, Irma busies herself raising cattle, which having fattened-up she sells for meat: she also buys cheese to sell in Trujillo and buys barley and wheat wholesale to sell in different zones of Trujillo town.

Irma began this business with her first loan of 300 Soles which she received from the communal “Alpha and Omega” bank, with which she bought a sack of wheat and barley and little by little she has been able to do this in larger quantities. Later, with subsequent loans, she established a grocery store, but she had to close this because there was too much competition. With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy concentrated feed for her animals and some sacks of wheat and barley.

Currently, Irma is part of a club of mothers called “Miraculous Medal”, and she feels very happy to offer her services in this club to help needy people in her community.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Irma Lucía tiene 34 años de edad, estudió primaria completa y tiene un hijo que aún depende de ella. Vive en el distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán, departamento de La Libertad.

Actualmente la señora Irma se dedica a la crianza de carneros, vacas para que después de engordarlos venda su carne, también compra quesillos para vender en la ciudad de Trujillo y compra cebada y trigo al por mayor para vender en diferentes zonas de la ciudad de Trujillo.

La señora Irma inició un negocio con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 que recibió en el Banco Comunal “Alfa y Omega”, con lo cual compró un saco de trigo y cebada y poco a poco fue haciéndolo en mayor cantidad. Posteriormente con sus siguientes préstamos puso una bodega, pero la tuvo que cerrar porque hay mucha competencia. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará alimento concentrado para sus animales y algunos sacos de trigo y cebada.

Actualmente la señora Irma forma parte del club de madres “Medalla Milagrosa” y se siente muy contenta de brindar sus servicios en este club para beneficiar a gente necesitada de su comunidad.

loans.use: Purcahse of concentrated animal feed and some sacks of wheat and barley

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a lady of 51 years. She is married with five children. She has applied for a loan to buy food and ingredients needed for making and running her business. She sells food at the nearby school every day. She also sells at companies near her house on weekends. She makes $140 WST ($56 USD) per day, and even more on weekends. She said she is very happy with her business because the money she earns helps to meet her family's needs. She hopes to stay in the program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy food and supplies for her fast food stall

loans.name: Apiseka

texts.en:
Apiseka is 38 years old. She is married with three children. There are nine people in her family.

Apiseka is a new member; she joined SPBD this year. She is one of the most popular tailors in her village. She has been sewing clothes for more than 10 years, since she was 27 years old. She sews t shirts, puletasi (traditional Samoan garb worn by women) and haloa. Groups also ask Apiseka to make uniforms for them. She earns about $450 WST ($180 USD) a week.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en:
Faatupu is 36 years old. She lives in Papaigalagala with her husband and their family of seven. She has three children who are all in school.

Faatupu joined the SPBD programme in late October 2007. She is now applying for her first loan. She has worked as a tailor for 7 years. The money she earns is the main income for her family; they depend on it. She earns $380 WST ($152 USD) in profit every week. The money helps her to pay for things like phone bills, food, church donations, and school fees. It will also help her to make her repayments every week.

loans.use: To buy supplies and materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Virginia Vda De

texts.es:
Virginia is a 58 years old widow, who presently lives with her two daugthers, of 18 and 22 years of age. In order to make a living for the family, she sells bread and food, having two years of experience in the business. The competition is almost nonexistent, as there are no other similar business in the area.

She will use the requested loan to renovate her house. The costs of materials vary depending on the supplier.

Her only credit history is with Agrocapital and, for the time she has been a client, she has proven to be a responsible and punctual person.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia es una señora viuda de 58 años de edad, que actualmente vive con sus dos hijas de 18 y 22 años. Para mantener a su familia, se dedica a la venta de pan y comida, negocios en los que tiene dos años de experiencia. La competencia es casi nula debido a que en la zona donde vive no hay otros negocios de estas características.

El dinero de la presente solicitud lo utilizará para la refacción de su vivienda; los precios de los materiales varian de acuerdo al proveedor.

Sólo tiene antecedentes crediticios en Agrocapital y, durante el tiempo de relación con la institución, demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual.

loans.use: Home renovation.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan is 36 years of age. His family consists of 7 members: five children who are 18, 16, 15, 12, and 5 years of age, all in school. The eldest studies and works as a secretary in the city of Santa Cruz. The family has rented a home in Ivirgarzama for 10 years. Juan has great projects planned, such as buying his own home, expanding his business, and helping his children develop their careers so that they may have better opportunities in the future. Juan has been repairing and selling spare parts for electronics for 10 years. He is well-experienced in this field. His business is located in Ivirgarzama on Leonardo Quispe Street. He likes the job he has chosen, and studied his trade in a vocational center. He was not able to obtain a college education due to his financial situation. Juan came to his present location from the city of Trinidad because he has more business and job opportunities in this tropical zone.

He has little competition in this area because there are only about 10 repair centers for television sets, sound systems, DVDs, etc., so the demand is high in this tropical region. The high humidity in this area causes electronic devices to malfunction, so people must turn to technicians, which is favorable for Juan’s business.

Juan is requesting this loan to buy more spare parts for electronics and thus improve customer service. For example, customers come in to have their electronic devices repaired, and Juan sometimes doesn’t have the necessary parts, which forces him to commute all the way to Cochabamba to get what he needs. This process not only wastes time, but also gives his business a bad reputation.

He has already requested 3 loans from our institution, and has good credit history. Despite the fact that they were not sizeable, his prior loans have been of great use to him and his business projects. As a result, he has been able to improve his business and his credibility as a technician. He is a growing entrepreneur in our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan tiene 36 años de edad, su familia esta compuesta por siete personas cinco hijos de 18,16,15,12 y 5 años de edad entre hombres y mujeres, todos estudian en el colegio, una de ellas que es la mayor estudia y trabaja como secretaria en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, viven en alquiler en la localidad de Ivirgarzama hace 10 años.

Juan tiene grandes proyectos tener una vivienda propia, un negocio mas grande y también de poder ver a sus hijos como profesionales para que tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.

Juan se dedica a la reparación y venta de repuestos de artefactos eléctricos hace mas de 10 años en la zona, tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro, esta ubicado en la localidad de Ivirgarzama sobre la calle Leonardo Quispe casi Av. Mortenson, le gusta el trabajo que emprendió en su vida, estudio para ello en un instituto de capacitación, no tuvo oportunidad de entrar a la universidad por razones económicas. Juan migró de la ciudad de trinidad, porque en el trópico hay mayores oportunidades de trabajo y negocio.

La competencia es menor en la localidad de Ivirgarzama ya que existen alrededor de 10 centros de reparación de artefactos eléctricos específicamente televisores, equipos de música, DVDs y otros, la demanda es alta en la zona, porque la zona tropical los artefactos eléctricos duran poco tiempo por varios factores sobre todo clima que es muy húmedo, la población necesariamente tiene que acudir al técnico lo que es muy favorable para Juan David porque hace sostenible su negocio y sus ingresos.

Juan solicito este crédito para la compra de repuestos de aparatos eléctricos, para mejorar la calidad de atención al cliente, por ejemplo un cliente viene y solicita la reparación y a veces Juan no tiene los repuestos necesarios para utilizarlos y necesariamente tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Cochabamba para traerlos cosa que demora mucho y puede representarle una mala imagen a su trabajo.

Él ya obtuvo varios créditos con nuestra institución, en una totalidad de 3 créditos, con un cumplimiento bueno, a pesar del pequeño monto que solicito en sus anteriores operaciones, le sirvió mucho, resultado de esté mejoro su trabajo y su imagen como técnico, es un cliente creciente en nuestra institución.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for electronics

loans.name: Jorge Felix

texts.es:
Jorge is 57 years old and has been separated from his former wife for many years, having taken charge of his children. The youngest son, 21 years old, lives with him but is becoming financially independent since he started working 8 months ago.

Jorge works as a taxi driver and delivers correspondence for a courier business as well. He has great experience as a taxi worker, since he’s been in the business for many years. He is also well known by some courier business that retain his services on a temporal basis.

There is an intermediate degree of competition in the field and, as the number of vehicles grows, so does the demand.

With the loan Jorge will buy tires for his taxi. The amount is sufficient for exactly four of them.

Jorge is a long time client of Agrocapital, the only lending institution he works with, and this is the sixth loan he has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge es un señor de 57 años de edad, se encuentra separado de su esposa hace muchos años y él se hizo cargo de sus hijos, el menor de los cuales -de 21 años- actualmente vive con él pero empezó a trabajar hace 8 meses, por lo que ya está independizándose económicamente.

Jorge se dedica al transporte de pasajeros brindando sus servicios como taxista, y aprovecha sus recorridos para hacer entregas de correspondencia para una empresa de courier. Trabaja con su taxi desde hace muchos años, por lo que tiene bastante experiencia. También es conocido por algunas empresas de courier que contratan temporalmente sus servicios.

La competencia en el rubro es media, y así como el parque automotor crece, también está creciendo la demanda.

Con el crédito comprara llantas para su taxi; el monto le alcanza exactamente para 4 llantas aro 13.

Jorge trabaja hace bastante tiempo con la institución, la única con la que trabaja, siendo este el sexto crédito que solicita en Agrocapital.

loans.use: Purchase of tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.es:
Delia is 52 years old and has seven children, Nancy is 35 years old and has one daughter, and Nelly is 38 years old and has three children. What they all have in common is their membership to “Dos Mil” (Two Thousand) Communal Bank. The tree of them mention that, in their Communal Bank, they learned to socialize, to better serve their customers and to save. They have been members of the Communal Bank for 3, 6 and 3 years respectively, and it’s during this time that they’ve been able to save. With her savings, Nancy was able to buy a TV, a fridge and a stereo, while Delia acquired a freezer for her business.

They run different businesses. In Nancy’s case, she has a small grocery store. She decided to start this business because there were no stores on her street.

Delia, on her part, sells ice creams that she elaborates herself. She sells them as a peddler, in front of the San Francisco de Asis church, in the downtown area of the city.

Finally, Nelly elaborates typical regional breads, such as “chapla”, sells them in the area and also ships them to a different province. She started in the business when she was 14 years old, as apprentice at different bakeries. When she was 25 years old, she managed to get her own oven.

In the future, they would like to see their businesses grow, stock them and be able to elaborate a wider variety of breads. They are requesting loans for 400, 1000 and 600 soles respectively, to be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oil, flour, dyes, fruits and additives.

Delia, Nancy and Nelly dream of their children becoming professionals, of buying a stretch of land to build a house, and of buying a car for a son to work.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Delia tiene 52 años y 7 hijos, Nancy tiene 35 años y 1 hija, y Nelly tiene 38 años y 3 hijos. Lo que ellas tienen en común es que son socias del Banco Comunal Dos Mil y las tres mencionan que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a socializarse, cómo atender al cliente, y a ahorrar. Son socias del Banco Comunal desde hace 3, 6 y 3 años respectivamente y es en todo este tiempo que han logrado ahorrar. Con los ahorros que logró reunir, Nancy pudo comprar su televisor, refrigeradora y un equipo de música, mientras que Delia compró una congeladora para su negocio.

Los negocios de ellas son diferentes. En el caso de Nancy, tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ella decidió iniciar este negocio porque no había tiendas en su cuadra.

Por otro lado, Delia vende helados que son elaborados por ella misma; sus ventas las hace en forma ambulante, frente a la Iglesia San Francisco de Asís, en el centro de la ciudad.

Finalmente, Nelly elabora panes típicos de la región como la “chapla” y los vende a las tiendas de la zona y también manda a otra provincia. Ella se inició en este negocio a los 14 años, como ayudante en diferentes hornos y, posteriormente, a los 25 años logró hacer su propio horno.

En el futuro ellas quisieran que sus negocios crezcan, surtir su negocio y poder elaborar mayor variedad de panes. Los préstamos que ellas necesitan son de 400, 1000 y 600 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite, harina, colorantes, frutas y estabilizadores.

Los sueños de Delia, Nancy y Nelly son que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar su terreno y construir su casa, y un carro para que pueda trabajar su hijo.

loans.use: They are requesting loans for 400, 1000 and 600 soles respectively, to be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oil, flour, dyes, fruits and additives.

loans.name: Hilda Yolanda

texts.es:
Hilda is asking for a loan to expand her business as she currently has no funds to buy stock. She wants to sell typical food such as Yuca, Pupusas, Cakes and also to sell fruit and vegetables. This would improve her ability to maintain her family’s quality of life.

Where Hilda lives is well located as her suburb is already very popular and will provide an excellent market for the products she wants to buy

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Solicita crédito para ampliar su negocio ya que actualmente no tiene los fondos para comprar productos. Ella quiere vender comida típica por ejemplo Yuca, Pupusas, pasteles y tambien vender frutas y verduras. Esto aumentaría la capacidad de mantener a su grupo familiar.

En donde vive ella está bien ubicado ya que la colonia es muy popular y le facilita la comercialización de los productos que quiere comprar.

loans.use: Business Expansion

payments.comment: Hilda was able to pay off her loan early. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Yesenía Carolina

texts.es:
Yesenía currently lives with a son in the Las Moritas suburb of Lurdes Colon. Her business began initially as a clothes store, but now she wants to continue this while increasing her stock of other products. She also wants to start selling typical food, for which she needs to buy a kitchen grill in order to make these typical dishes and to have another source of income for her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Actualmente vive con un hijo en Colonia Las Morítas de Lourdes Colón. Su negocio inicialmente lo comenzó con venta de ropa, actualmente lo mantiene y quiere incrementarlo surtiendola con más producto. Tambien quiere iniciar la venta de comida Típica, para lo cual necesita comprar una "cocina plancha" para elaborar estos platos típicos y tener otra fuente de ingreso para su familia.

loans.use: Increase merchandise

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.es:
Soledad, Lidia y Katy are members of the “Dos Mil” (Two Thousand) Communal Bank. Soledad is single, while Katy and Lidia are married and have children.

Soledad sells ice creams as a peddler in the downtown area of the city. She used to work at a restaurant and started this business following the advice of a friend.

Lidia, on her part, buys and sells potato wholesale at the Santa Elena market. She also cultivates it in Matara.

On the other hand, Katy sells clothes on demand and, along with her husband, owns a Mototaxi. Taking advantage of the Christmas season, she will also sell toys.

Soledad, Lidia and Katy say there is camaraderie in their Communal Bank, which is patent when a member gets sick or has a special need and they collect money to support her. Soledad, Lidia and Katy are requesting loans for 200, 800 and 200 soles respectively, to be invested in the purchase of ice creams and popsicles, potato and for the repair of the mototaxi. Their savings are for their children, for emergency situations and, in Soledad’s case, for her higher studies.

They have many dreams: Lidia wishes for a big cart to transport her products, Soledad wants to become a professional and Katy wants a united family and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Soledad, Lidia y Katy son socias del Banco Comunal Dos Mil. Soledad es soltera, mientras que Katy y Lidia son casadas y tienen hijos.

Soledad vende helados en forma ambulante en el centro de la ciudad. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como empleada en restaurantes y por consejo de una amiga inició este negocio.

Por su parte, Lidia compra y vende papa al por mayor en el mercado de Santa Elena, y también siembra papa en Matara.

Por otro lado, Katy vende ropa a pedido, y junto a su esposo tienen una Mototaxi. Aprovechando la temporada navideña, también venderá juguetes.

Soledad, Lidia y Katy dicen que en su Banco Comunal hay compañerismo, que se demuestra cuando una socia se enferma o tiene alguna necesidad y ellas hacen una colecta para poder apoyarla. Soledad, Lidia y Katy necesitan préstamos de 200, 800 y 200 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de helados, chupetes, papa y para la reparación de su Mototaxi. Sus ahorros son para sus hijos, alguna emergencia y, en el caso de Soledad, para sus estudios superiores.

Sus sueños son muchos, como el caso de Lidia, quien sueña con comprar un carro grande para transportar su carga; Soledad quiere ser profesional y Katy quiere tener una familia unida y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Soledad, Lidia and Katy are requesting loans for 200, 800 and 200 soles respectively, to be invested in the purchase of ice creams and popsicles, potato and for the repair of the mototaxi.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
